commit_message:
'updated_at' field shows old value after resource is saved

chassis.save() and port.save() doesn't update object from db
because of which 'updated_at' field for the object
is not up-to-date after a save(). This commit fixes this issue.

Partial-Bug:#1281638
Change-Id: I98af458e95f7ed3c787a9bcf2550f89e471ccd21

commit_message:
Container servers are wrongly scheduled to non-docker hypervisor

In an environment with more than one hypervisor type including QEMU and
docker, when creating a container server, the request can be wrongly
scheduled to a QEMU hypervisor.

Fixes Bug 1427098

Change-Id: I734a7d66eceac07c0e4490134f6c5a99942168d8

commit_message:
API: provide meaning error when neutron is down

When doing a 'nova list' and the neutron service is down the
access for the security groups for the instance will throw an
exception.

This logs the exception and returns a meaningful exception to the
user.

Change-Id: I45ec4b5471d85b2dc05f4aeb35bffc078efa2317
Closes-bug: #1437863

commit_message:
Enabling direct workflow cycles: adding a test that now doesn't pass

Change-Id: I13b9835cf763b324bffc051f52b02b55235f4477
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/52/214552/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 - Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging import testtools from mistral.db.v2 import api as db_api from mistral.services import workflows as wf_service from mistral.tests.unit.engine import base from mistral.workflow import states LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) # Use the set_default method to set value otherwise in certain test cases # the change in value is not permanent. cfg.CONF.set_default('auth_enable', False, group='pecan') class DirectWorkflowWithCyclesTest(base.EngineTestCase): @testtools.skip('Make it work.') def test_direct_workflow_on_closures(self): wf_text = """ version: '2.0' wf: vars: cnt: 0 output: cnt: <% $.cnt %> tasks: task1: on-complete: - task2 task2: action: std.echo output=2 publish: cnt: <% $.cnt + 1 %> on-success: - task3 task3: action: std.echo output=3 on-success: - task2: <% $.cnt < 2 %> """ wf_service.create_workflows(wf_text) wf_ex = self.engine.start_workflow('wf', {}) self._await(lambda: self.is_execution_success(wf_ex.id)) wf_ex = db_api.get_workflow_execution(wf_ex.id) task_execs = wf_ex.task_executions # Expecting one execution for task1 and two executions # for task2 and task3 because of the cycle 'task2 <-> task3'. task1_ex = self._assert_single_item(task_execs, name='task1') task2_execs = self._assert_multiple_items(task_execs, 2, name='task2') task3_execs = self._assert_multiple_items(task_execs, 2, name='task3') self.assertEqual(5, len(task_execs)) self.assertTrue(wf_ex.state, states.SUCCESS) self.assertTrue(task1_ex.state, states.SUCCESS) self.assertTrue(task2_execs[0].state, states.SUCCESS) self.assertTrue(task2_execs[1].state, states.SUCCESS) self.assertTrue(task3_execs[0].state, states.SUCCESS) self.assertTrue(task3_execs[1].state, states.SUCCESS) self.assertEqual(3, wf_ex.output['result'])

commit_message:
Activate pep8 check that _ is imported

Remove the specification in tox.ini that _ is a builtin so that
it will no longer assume that _ does not need to be imported.
This helps ensure that the _ from i18n is used.

Activating this check did not flag any violations.

Change-Id: I7b3528e07aee6138563ad83c2caa08ecbe49f933

commit_message:
Merge `clean.py` into `utils.py`

clean.py is introduced with commit id: b69dbc2f2748, the main usage
of this module is checking property's name, type etc.

The methods in that module provide the general functionality which could
be used by keystone rather than stick to specific entity, since utils.py
existing for the same purpose there is no need to give a new file
named 'clean', and the module itself named 'clean.py' make user confused
and not clear what's the module used for.

Change-Id: I3839d3522e6d91dcfd161266237acc2c688f62b9

commit_message:
Make the review list sortable by review type

Especially for bug review days it makes sense to sort the current
review list by review type (high prio bugfix, medium prio bugfix, ...)
This patch set introduces a new column "type" and allows a sorting for
it.

Change-Id: I3d37cccb8d6f75f6eebc2cf8ab9136ac50d4cf89

commit_message:
archive_policy: validate agg methods values

This creates a custom option that validate the input for the valid
default aggregation methods used in archive policies.

PS: Unfortunately, the oslo.config generator is dumb and does not know
the type of option so it has trouble generating that correctly, but it
still works anyway and it's included in the sample config.

Change-Id: Ie1f9378063d37607e81f400f6a7d506f6a4954ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/27/210727/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_config import typesOPTS = [ cfg.Opt( 'default_aggregation_methods', default=['mean', 'min', 'max', 'sum', 'std', 'median', 'count', '95pct'], type=types.List( item_type=types.String( choices=ArchivePolicy.VALID_AGGREGATION_METHODS)), help='Default aggregation methods to use in created archive policies'), ]
deleted_lines: OPTS = [ cfg.ListOpt( 'default_aggregation_methods', default=['mean', 'min', 'max', 'sum', 'std', 'median', 'count', '95pct'], # TODO(jd) Validate values # choices=ArchivePolicy.VALID_AGGREGATION_METHODS, help='Default aggregation methods to use in created archive policies'), ]

commit_message:
Give more informative message for deployment graph

Sometimes we have situation when requires or required_for
uses task id which not described in system. In such case
nailgun should show places where it happens

Change-Id: I8004e18a396328f3051f4878da138c7a286450f0
Closes-Bug: #1477258

commit_message:
Drop no longer supported releases

According to http://ceph.com/docs/master/releases/ only firefly and hammer
are supported versions by ceph.com.
Therefore this proposes to drop the no longer supported versions from the
tests.

Change-Id: Ibe738e7f17e4632e5d1deeabc4e6f937f1b1366a

commit_message:
Add Driver_ID Column support to Generic Driver

This is a test implementation example for a proposal to separate the API ID
from the Driver ID, which is a requirement for Share Migration.

This patch includes the changes required to update the generic driver to be
compatible with Migration, if the Driver_ID Column approach is used.

- share['driver_id'] field should be used for Private Driver Storage access
and for dependencies, such as volumes

Change-Id: Ied2cdbf9295100b401905e97d8496e7cd5f52d81
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/67/193667/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: volume = self._get_volume(context, share['id']) share['id'], {'volume_id': volume['id']}) volume = self._get_volume(context, share['id']) volume = self._get_volume(self.admin_context, share['id']) self.private_storage.delete(share['id']) volume = self._get_volume(self.admin_context, snapshot['share_id']) volume = self._get_volume(context, share['id']) linked_volume_name = self._get_volume_name(share['id']) share['id'], {'volume_id': share_volume['id']})

commit_message:
Add Driver_ID Column Proposal for migration

This is a test implementation example for a proposal to separate the API ID
from the Driver ID, which is a requirement for Share Migration.

- Added a new column driver_id
- driver_id value is derived from share_id at share creation
- The driver_id field is used as the share_id in driver code

In this approach, drivers do not neeed to implement a "change_share_id()"
method, but all drivers must use share['driver_id'] field.

Change-Id: I7c8c9a868f76c1683f0bbb8034aafb1222bc737b

commit_message:
Fix /dev populating during image building

It turns out that /dev has got broken links during image building.
This leads to fail of installing tricky packages such as dkms.

Having /dev/fd -> /proc/self/fd totally resolves that issue.

Change-Id: I72865f2b2adcb431d959fa2a73b51d9abad5914b
Closes-Bug: #1485565
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-agent refs/changes/30/214230/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # prevent failures related with /dev/fd/62 utils.execute('chroot', chroot, 'rm', '-fr', '/dev/fd') utils.execute('chroot', chroot, 'ln', '-s', '/proc/self/fd', '/dev/fd')

commit_message:
Make /var/log/puppet.log readable only to root

This file is currently world-readable and exposes all passwords used for
deployment, including OpenStack services and MySQL database.

Change-Id: I0be5ffd806ddf708344205fe374f716e4cd2d831
Closes-bug: 1486399

log_data container. This container is then used with 'volumes_from' on
all other containers. This allows all logs to exist in all containers.

Additionally, it is a hook for a log processing container such as a

Implements: blueprint logging-container

commit_message:
Add log aggregation for Ansible into 'log_data'

This creates a VOLUME for all the places logs would appear in the
log_data container. This container is then used with 'volumes_from' on
all other containers. This allows all logs to exist in all containers.

Additionally, it is a hook for a log processing container such as a
container running rsyslog and/or ELKStack processes.

Change-Id: I58b950a3289465bd91fee97d834e5069734a670c
Implements: blueprint logging-container

commit_message:
Adding spec for integration of Sahara CLI with OpenstackClient

Partially implements: blueprint cli-as-openstackclient-plugin

Change-Id: I1071fd9099b18af424ef88b43627d8a23d93afb3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-specs refs/changes/96/206096/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================= SaharaClient CLI as an OpenstackClient plugin ============================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/python-saharaclient/+spec/cli-as-openstackclient-plugin This specification proposes to create SaharaClient CLI as an OpenstackClient plugin. Problem description =================== Currently SaharaClient CLI has a lot of problems and is not so attractive as wanted to be. It should be refactored or recreated from the start. Proposed change =============== New SaharaClient CLI will be based on OpenstackClient that brings the command set for different projects APIs together in a single shell with a uniform command structure. OpenStackClient provides first class support for the several services. The other ones (including Data Processing service) may create an OpenStackClient plugin. Proposed Objects: * plugin * image * data source * job template * job * job binary * node group template * cluster template * cluster Proposed Commands: All commands will have a prefix ``dataprocessing`` Arguments in ``[]`` are optional, in ``<>`` are positional. For Plugins: .. sourcecode:: shell plugin list [--long] plugin show <plugin> plugin get configs <plugin> <version> [--file <file>] Detailed description of a plugin contains too much information to display it on the screen. It will be saved in file instead. For Images: .. sourcecode:: shell image register <image> <username> [--description <description>] image unregister <image(s)> image set tags <image> <tags> image add tags <image> <tags> image remove tags <image> <tags> ``set tags`` will replace current image tags with provided ones. ``remove tags`` will support passing ``all`` to ``tags`` argument to remove all tags For Data Sources: .. sourcecode:: shell data source create <name> <type> <url> [--pass <password>] [--user <user>] [--description <description>] data source list [--type <type>] data source show <datasource> data source delete <datasource> data source update <datasource> [--name <name>] [--type <type>] [--pass <password>] [--user <user>] [--description <description>] For Job Templates (Jobs): .. sourcecode:: shell job template create job template list job template show job template delete job template get configs job types list For Jobs (Job executions): .. sourcecode:: shell job execute job list job show job delete For Job Binaries: .. sourcecode:: shell job binary create job binary list job binary show job binary update job binary delete job binary get file For Node Group Templates: .. sourcecode:: shell node_group_template_create node_group_template_list node_group_template_show node_group_template_update node_group_template_delete For Cluster Templates: .. sourcecode:: shell cluster template create cluster template list cluster template show cluster template update cluster template delete For Clusters: .. sourcecode:: shell cluster create cluster scale cluster list cluster show cluster delete Besides this, there are a bunch of arguments provided by OpenstackClient, that depends on command plugin. For example, there is a help output for ``plugin list`` command: .. sourcecode:: shell (openstack) help dataprocessing plugin list usage: dataprocessing plugin list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value, yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--long] Lists plugins optional arguments: -h, --help show this help message and exit --long List additional fields in output output formatters: output formatter options -f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}, --format {csv,html,json,table,value, yaml} the output format, defaults to table -c COLUMN, --column COLUMN specify the column(s) to include, can be repeated table formatter: --max-width <integer> Maximum display width, 0 to disable CSV Formatter: --quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric} when to include quotes, defaults to nonnumeric Alternatives ------------ Current CLI code can be refactored. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Deployer impact --------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Sahara-image-elements impact ---------------------------- None Sahara-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: apavlov-n Work Items ---------- * Creating OpenstackClient plugin for SaharaClient * Commands implementation for each object, described in "Proposed change" section * Updating documentation with corresponding changes Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Every command will be provided with unit tests. Documentation Impact ==================== Documentation about new CLI usage will be written. References ========== `OpenstackClient documentation about using Plugins <http://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-openstackclient/plugins.html>`_ `OpenstackClient documentation about Objects and Actions naming <http://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-openstackclient/commands.html>`_

commit_message:
Enable remote logging for components run under Apache

For now that consists of keystone_wsgi and horizon. Also remove
pointless notifying rsyslog::service as it's already done by
rsyslog::imfile resource.

Change-Id: I50cf762dab2e805ccb5b30465641370a65bfed3d

commit_message:
Clarify the origin of provider warning messages

Since the scope is not printed it can be difficult to determine
where a warning message originated. This patch adds a prefix of the
type name to the providers that have warning messages.

Change-Id: Iaca8383130d1ede6b8710f5d465573c12b9ecdf0

commit_message:
Catch v3 keystone unauthorized error when creating stack

If v3 keystone unauthorized error raise during creating stack,
then this stack will remaid in status of create_in_progress. This
patch modify heat keystoneclient to catch unauthorized error and
set stack status to failed.

Closes-Bug: #1376213
Closes-Bug: #1450923
Change-Id: I9a34c20fc6ac3ce235aaba4eac25a6d5ceb43f5f
(cherry picked from commit dca8e37e651c32aca7224fda208e1241efbf23f2)

commit_message:
Fernet 'expires' value loses 'ms' after validation

When we create a Fernet token we get a token with an expiration
time which contains microseconds. When we validate a Fernet token,
the expiration time changes and comes back missing the microseconds.
We need to make the expiration time the same between creation and
validation time, having microseconds in both cases. This applies to
both v2 and v3 API.

Conflicts:
    keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_auth.py
    keystone/tests/unit/token/test_fernet_provider.py
    keystone/token/providers/fernet/core.py
    keystone/token/providers/fernet/token_formatters.py

NOTE: This backport differs from the patch to master to handle the
difference in oslo.timeutils versus the move to keystone's own
implementation of isotime in master, and to move the fix in
keystone/token/providers/fernet/core.py to avoid having to backport a
significant refactor Fernet's implementation.

Closes-Bug: #1459790
Change-Id: Ic6adbc2d69af03519a2c4ef66d558bcff9022049
(cherry picked from commit 9391f9307e834f437c6712797c903921881f2977)

commit_message:
Test to ensure fernet key rotation results in new key sets

This amends the existing rotation test to ensure that after each key
rotation, a completely new set of keys exists on disk. This is just a
paranoid test to ensure that the key rotation strategy isn't something
terribly dumb like "shuffle all key files on disk without creating any
new ones."

Change-Id: Ie897bd9d41ff96ed6819cbee0053853701afc9d1
(cherry picked from commit 3183a801c7c1b97287234e225f096c93568a616a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/49/212949/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import hashlib def setUp(self): super(TestFernetKeyRotation, self).setUp() # A collection of all previously-seen signatures of the key # repository's contents. self.key_repo_signatures = set() @property def key_repository_signature(self): """Create a "thumbprint" of the current key repository. Because key files are renamed, this produces a hash of the contents of the key files, ignoring their filenames. The resulting signature can be used, for example, to ensure that you have a unique set of keys after you perform a key rotation (taking a static set of keys, and simply shuffling them, would fail such a test). """ # Load the keys into a list. keys = fernet_utils.load_keys() # Sort the list of keys by the keys themselves (they were previously # sorted by filename). keys.sort() # Create the thumbprint using all keys in the repository. signature = hashlib.sha1() for key in keys: signature.update(key) return signature.hexdigest() def assertRepositoryState(self, expected_size): """Validate the state of the key repository.""" self.assertEqual(expected_size, self.key_repository_size) self.assertUniqueRepositoryState() def assertUniqueRepositoryState(self): """Ensures that the current key repo state has not been seen before.""" # This is assigned to a variable because it takes some work to # calculate. signature = self.key_repository_signature # Ensure the signature is not in the set of previously seen signatures. self.assertNotIn(signature, self.key_repo_signatures) # Add the signature to the set of repository signatures to validate # that we don't see it again later. self.key_repo_signatures.add(signature) # Validate the initial repository state. self.assertRepositoryState(expected_size=min_active_keys) # The repository should be initialized with a staged key (0) and a # primary key (1). The next key is just auto-incremented. next_key_number = exp_keys[-1] + 1 # keep track of next key self.assertRepositoryState(expected_size=rotation + 3) exp_keys.append(next_key_number) next_key_number += 1 # We should have a fully populated key repository now. self.assertRepositoryState(expected_size=max_active_keys) exp_keys.append(next_key_number) next_key_number += 1
deleted_lines: key_no = 2 # keep track of next key self.assertEqual(rotation + 3, self.key_repository_size) exp_keys.append(key_no) key_no += 1 self.assertEqual(max_active_keys, self.key_repository_size) exp_keys.append(key_no) key_no += 1

commit_message:
Reduce number of Fernet log messages

This particular message gets quite repetitive as it's logged per token
creation & validation request. Once max_active_keys is reached, it has
little utility beyond letting you know that the number of active Fernet
keys is (still) correct.

NOTE: Unlike the patch to master, this backport does not change the log
message itself, only whether or not it is logged.

Change-Id: I6f497a5defa3c1da5bda54aa5f9e7303a0352d83
Closes-Bug: 1452418
(cherry picked from commit 207e9783bdc5ae6200a77f3307197777634da951)

Once # the number of keys matches max_active_keys, this log entry is too # repetitive to be useful. LOG.info(_LI( 'Loaded %(count)d encryption keys (max_active_keys=%(max)d) from: ' '%(dir)s'), { 'count': len(keys), 'max': CONF.fernet_tokens.max_active_keys, 'dir': CONF.fernet_tokens.key_repository})

commit_message:
Handle non-numeric files in key_repository

It is very likely administrators will leave behind bits and pieces in a
live environment. One cannot assume that all of the files in a directory
will be the ones created by Keystone.

Change-Id: I5841a11f599f79d2efbe1a176f499e280a91cb37
Closes-Bug: #1478656

commit_message:
Replace 401 to 404 when token is invalid

According to specs, keystone should return 404 when token is invalid.
This commit fixes it, and fixes validate_token return.

Change-Id: Ia44ea94c6f72ab6f46c0799056d41deddcbfb051
Closes-Bug: 1477600
(cherry picked from commit 7bdeef83535dafae8f3e1ba95ad661e90912938b)

commit_message:
Additional Fernet test coverage

This expands existing test coverage to include Fernet tokens, a few of
which expose a couple issues (see related bugs below).

NOTE: The config fixture in keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_auth.py L536
needed to be revised to use a full class path, rather than the
stevedore-based entry point loading introduced to keystone during the
liberty release cycle.

Change-Id: I53374d41e4e5453817b6635aee56df625073d015
Related-Bug: 1459790
Related-Bug: 1475762
(cherry picked from commit a8c57027dad13389e1aebc242e18f9e05726b349)

commit_message:
Set validatable False by default

The common create_test_server should use validatable False by
default. At least for now, no validation should be setup unless
specifically requested, so that validatable needs only be
set in the few tests that include ssh checks.

Change-Id: I56b1b15c613edf6ea6fbe48117fb48d71c37e191

commit_message:
Full response for v3 ServiceClient methods

Provide the entire response object for all methods of the v3
ServiceClient

partially implements: blueprint method-return-value-and-move-service-clients-to-lib

commit_message:
pci: Remove objects.InstancePCIRequests.save()

The save() method of nova.objects.InstancePCIRequests was never called
anywhere but some unit tests. Remove this method because it is
confusing, since all creation of instance PCI request objects is done in
nova.objects.Instance.create() and nova.objects.Instance.save().

Change-Id: I329d07f5bb5a5ce86544b3fe278e9e396fa03e1d

commit_message:
Increase size of nodes.driver column

While the composition spec didn't land, we have the option to
specify the boot interface using the driver name. This patch
increases the 'driver' column on the nodes table to hold longer
driver names.

It's size has been agreed upon in the 2015-08-17 meeting. See minutes at
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/ironic/2015/ironic.2015-08-17-17.00.html

Change-Id: Id85d8a62b43f5d40479f6d5857cc11d9f765ac62
Closes-bug: #1481829

subject: Add missing rules in policy.json
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-04 02:13:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a01e36e88e8d35b5c47b3894dbb509d46a1aa1f3', 'message': "API: Add test case to verify policy.json

This patch adds a test case to veify the contents of policy.json.

In v2.1 api, we move all policy enforcement out of compute API and DB layer to
RESTAPI layer, and we use the policy rules defined in policy.json to do policy
enforcement, so we need to test the rules in policy.json are all configured
correctly.

Adding admin role, admin_or_onwer role and default role list, all the roles'
list are based from currently policy.json file. It will be easier for developer
to adding a new 'default' policy rule in policy.json since we put them grouped.

So any new policy.json changes made, we need to modify this test case.

Change-Id: Ic0780a0d1ccf96c14f1e0ad9c3e9b23e2b0db0ea
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-18 13:52:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ae30166b225a22656a8f268ab64d7ac6280ebfcc', 'message': "Add missing rules in polcy.json

'etc/nova/policy.json' is sample file for polcy configration. But
there are a lot of rule missing in it. The user is hard to find
out which rule can be used in nova.

This patch adds the missing rule back to policy.json. Also adds a
test case to veify the contents of policy.

Co-Authored-By: Alex Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>

Closes-Bug: #1435390
Change-Id: Ic0780a0d1ccf96c14f1e0ad9c3e9b23e2b0db0ea
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-29 10:15:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b6ed84743ec786fbb789a4520d57ceb528bec934', 'message': "Add missing rules in polcy.json

commit_message:
Add missing rules in policy.json

'etc/nova/policy.json' is sample file for polcy configration. But
there are a lot of rule missing in it. The user is hard to find
out which rule can be used in nova.

This patch adds the missing rule back to policy.json. Also adds a
test case to veify the contents of policy.

SecurityImpact
UpgradeImpact:
"os_compute_api:servers:create:forced_host" is missing in policy.json.
That means it will be default rule. But actually it should be admin
only API. This patch adds this rule back to policy.json and with
correct rule. Deployer should update their policy.json to match the
original permission also.

Co-Authored-By: Alex Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>

Closes-Bug: #1435390
Change-Id: Ic0780a0d1ccf96c14f1e0ad9c3e9b23e2b0db0ea

commit_message:
Full response for DataProcessingClient methods

Since service clients need to be migrated to Tempest-lib, they should
not truncate any things from API response. Current DataProcessing client
cuts out the top key of a response and returns only value to the caller.
All service clients should return the response as they get it from APIs.

Change-Id: I0d2d47db0ccfb306269a60557c4e510082ad0d3e
Partially-implements: blueprint method-return-value-and-move-service-clients-to-lib

commit_message:
Fix serializer supported version reporting in object_backport

The serializer needs to report the version of the toplevel object
that we were trying to deserialize when we encountered the incompatible
version. We depend on the implementor of the indirection_api to use
the object relationship mappings to return to us a fully-supported
object tree based on the version at the top.

This patch fixes the serializer to report the toplevel version instead
of the one that caused the fault.

Conflicts:
        nova/objects/base.py
        nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflicts are due to the NovaObjectRegistry not
existing in Kilo.

Change-Id: I7ac03717e17cd7229abfeef6d9c7d9d8ec9be27a
Closes-Bug: #1475356
(cherry picked from commit 7c0e2238eb003ac0c620f4b63fa92baa6675e724)

If wrong, this will be '1.6', which is the max # child version in our registry. backport.assert_called_once_with(self.context, prim, '1.1')

commit_message:
Apache servers will not reporting version anymore

In order to make it more difficult to know which
httpd server is running, here is a change to 
reduce the ServerTokens OS to ServerTokens Prod
and the ServerSignature On to ServerSignature Off.

This removes ServerName and version report
on page footer and reduces the detail of the httpd
server running in the headers to "Apache". 

These options can be overwritten by an user variable

Change-Id: I1aaffaa3b6b7d6574aefac65b6027e62240a702b
Closes-Bug: #1484256

commit_message:
Fix resource leaking when consume_from_instance raise exception

When we boot instance with force host, and the instance
request some pci devices, all the scheduler filters
would been ignored, include: PciPassthroughFilter.
So if the specified host can't apply the pci request,
PciDeviceRequestFailed exception would been raised
from HostState.consume_from_instance, at this time
the part of compute resource had been updated,
e.g. vcpus, ram, disk and so on, we should make
the resource of HostState having chance to been reverted
in order to avoid resource leaking.

When the exception is raised from self.pci_stats.apply_requests(),
catch it and don't set the update field of HostState,
HostState will be synced with db in next scheduling,
the resource is reverted at that time.

Change-Id: I0a87088d56337bcd180606013a5473fa2ec6c608
Related-Bug: #1391816
Closes-Bug: #1482019

commit_message:
Bump oslo.db to version 2.4

Gate is now using oslo.db 2.4.0 which has some changes to sort_dir
support. This is breaking test cases where 2.0 version is used.

Change-Id: Ia42361da0430fc42d98b4552f25c5e93890ac00c

commit_message:
Reduce AIO affinities and disable Ceilometer deployment

As hpcloud instances struggle to complete builds in master, we need
to reduce the resources we use on each instance in order to complete
builds.

This patch reduces the container affinities for the keystone, galera,
rabbit_mq, horizon and repo containers in an effort to do so.

This patch also disables Ceilometer deployment to help reduce
resource utilisation.

Change-Id: I34030633b263ea817b15555321602018470a69d2
Related-Bug: #1485917
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/76/214676/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Reduce the container affinities # TODO: this is a workaround due to hpcloud resource constraints # ref: https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1485917 export NUM_keystone_CONTAINERS=1 export NUM_galera_CONTAINERS=1 export NUM_rabbit_mq_CONTAINERS=1 export NUM_horizon_CONTAINERS=1 export NUM_repo_CONTAINERS=1

commit_message:

commit_message:
Tintri snapshot id

Tintri driver to associate cinder snapshot id to tintri id and
store in cinder snapshot provider_id.

Bump up driver version for this change.

Cinder snapshot name and volume id are stored in tintri snapshot.

Closes-Bug: #1468949
Co-Authored-By: apoorvad apps.desh@gmail.com
Co-Authored-By: opencompute xuchenx@gmail.com

Change-Id: I41e174d361491c3976b037a4aa16a085afbc93e5

commit_message:
mistral-dashboard - fixed the installation readme:
fixed an issue where horizon was not showing mistral dashboard upon installation.

* refactored soft link to an hard file copy:
The soft link wasn't a good solution as scripts were still missing _50_mistral.py
Horizon wasn't showing due to the above.
Verified in apache log files (my own and Liat's setup running a clean installation)

Partially implements blueprint:mistral-documentation

Change-Id: Ic237937d1ec33fd60fd846b30e2117536b614cf2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral-dashboard refs/changes/85/213685/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use database_user_create in the register operation

The register operation was registering user_database which is a global
variable in group_vars/all.yml.  This results in glance not being deployable
because user_database is overwrriten at keystone task registration time.

The result of this is the playbooks fail to deploy.

Change-Id: Ic69725fb09aa0a368ec5b0d8f47bfc768c29c70c
Closes-Bug: #1486876

commit_message:
Contains the directory name of sys and proc when creating ramdisk for ironic-agent

When the ubuntu/ipa ramdisk is created using DIB is deployed with ironic agent-ilo driver, the os cannot be started successfully. It failed at the point of trying to mount sys and proc filesystem.

Change-Id: I0dcc5f322024d2a4c016e99cb423b717803044c9
Signed-off-by: Gary Duan <duanlg@live.cn>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/52/215052/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: sudo find . -path ./sys -prune -o -path ./proc -prune -o -path './tmp/*' -prune -o -print | sudo cpio -o -H newc | gzip > ${IMAGE_PATH}.initramfs

added_lines: def test_with_items_retry_policy(self): workflow = """--- version: "2.0" with_items_retry: tasks: task1: with-items: i in [1, 2, 3] action: std.fail retry: count: 3 delay: 2 on-error: task2 task2: action: std.echo output="With-items failed" """ wf_service.create_workflows(workflow) # Start workflow. wf_ex = self.engine.start_workflow('with_items_retry', {}) self._await( lambda: self.is_execution_success(wf_ex.id) ) # Note: We need to reread execution to access related tasks. wf_ex = db_api.get_workflow_execution(wf_ex.id) tasks = wf_ex.task_executions self.assertEqual(2, len(tasks)) task1 = self._assert_single_item(tasks, name='task1') self.assertEqual( 2, task1.runtime_context['retry_task_policy']['retry_no'] ) self.assertEqual(9, len(task1.executions)) self._assert_multiple_items(task1.executions, 3, accepted=True) def test_with_items_retry_policy_concurrency(self): workflow = """--- version: "2.0" with_items_retry_concurrency: tasks: task1: with-items: i in [1, 2, 3, 4] action: std.fail retry: count: 3 delay: 2 concurrency: 1 on-error: task2 task2: action: std.echo output="With-items failed" """ wf_service.create_workflows(workflow) # Start workflow. wf_ex = self.engine.start_workflow( 'with_items_retry_concurrency', {} ) self._await( lambda: self.is_execution_success(wf_ex.id), ) # Note: We need to reread execution to access related tasks. wf_ex = db_api.get_workflow_execution(wf_ex.id) tasks = wf_ex.task_executions self.assertEqual(2, len(tasks)) task1 = self._assert_single_item(tasks, name='task1') self.assertEqual(12, len(task1.executions)) self._assert_multiple_items(task1.executions, 4, accepted=True)

commit_message:
Cap oslo.db to less than 2.4

oslo.db 2.4.0 breaks migration for alembic. This causes some projects gate
failure (magnum/cue).
This avoid to use oslo.db 2.4.

Change-Id: I6e2e68db1be20f1b3b1de80084d3707b4e2d35ea
Related-Bug: #1486655

commit_message:
Set the supported extensions correctly

To run the correct set of tempest tests, set the supported extensions
correctly in the settings file.

'provider' was purposely left out in this patch since the midonet
plugin's support for this extension is not conventional.  It will be
investigated in a separate patch.

Change-Id: I3c3034140384b777b9d4a0b7166fa742b6f706bc
Partially-Implements: bp/clean-up-devstack-plugin
Signed-off-by: Ryu Ishimoto <ryu@midokura.com>

commit_message:
mistral-dashboard: executions input & output modal header - added corresponding name

* fixed IO modal header name to show corresponding “Input” or “Output” instead of “Code View”
* fixed execution list task column header to "tasks"

Partially implements blueprint: mistral-dashboard-executions-screen

Change-Id: Ic70decc9f7c54bda9842f61d57d9e31cbac1a96b

subject: Add pagination support for actions query API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-20 05:32:57.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/api/controllers/v2/action.py', 'mistral/db/v2/api.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/api/v2/test_actions.py', 'mistral/tests/functional/api/v2/test_mistral_basic_v2.py', 'mistral/api/controllers/resource.py', 'mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'mistral/api/controllers/v2/workflow.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/9f95f3775f9f012ca44e1ed26066799a68669dd9', 'message': 'Add pagination support for actions query API

Add query params for action list REST API:

* limit: return a maximun number of items at a time, default is None, the
  query result will include all the resource items, which is backward
  compatible.

* marker: the ID of the last item in the previous list.

* sort_keys: columns to sort results by. Default: name, which is backward
  compatible.

* sort_dirs: directions to sort corresponding to sort_keys, "asc" or
  "desc" can be choosed. Default: asc. The length of sort_dirs can
  be equal or less than that of sort_keys.

Change-Id: Ied5b48244cc94a3039ebafce40f3c2ae25f9a48e
Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-pagination-support
'}]
commit_message:
Add pagination support for actions query API

Add query params for action list REST API:

* limit: return a maximun number of items at a time, default is None, the
  query result will include all the resource items, which is backward
  compatible.

* marker: the ID of the last item in the previous list.

* sort_keys: columns to sort results by. Default: name, which is backward
  compatible.

* sort_dirs: directions to sort corresponding to sort_keys, "asc" or
  "desc" can be choosed. Default: asc. The length of sort_dirs can
  be equal or less than that of sort_keys.

Change-Id: Ied5b48244cc94a3039ebafce40f3c2ae25f9a48e
Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-pagination-support

commit_message:
Implementing with-items concurrency

 * It allows executor to run at most N actions
   related to current with-items task at a time.

Implements blueprint: with-items-concurrency
Related-Bug: #1476871
Related-Bug: #1484483

Change-Id: Ifb193f06ae8e9becb6c43f36c07f5ffddb04c71c

commit_message:
Fix OS_AUTH_URL to adapt to v3/v2.0 split

Without this patch, openrc and env vars get
passed directly through as-is without being
modified, but OS_API_IDENTITY_VERSION was,
causing breakage.

Change-Id: I63278fbb34d4a2e37861d0ec411226feb27ef9dc
Related-Bug: #1479879

commit_message:
Mock correct cred_get function in unit test of lb_policy

We should mock cred_get function defined in senlin.db.api module
rather than senlin.db.sqlalchemy.api module in lb_policy unit test.
This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: Ic4d0ff03ca97071fc19bc87c6f083ee13350eda7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/31/215031/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from senlin.db import api as db_api
deleted_lines: from senlin.db.sqlalchemy import api as db_api

commit_message:
Update get_endpoint to use credentials auth_url first

endpoint URL should use credentials class auth_url to
take advantage of replacing v2/v3 endpoint URL from
openrc or env vars. If lookup fails, fall back to
old lookup forms.

Added acceptance test runs with openrc and env vars.

Depends-On: I63278fbb34d4a2e37861d0ec411226feb27ef9dc
Change-Id: I33c932f3dd4bacf95e44d5291e7b3bdb1597974f
Related-Bug: #1479879
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/90/207890/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: endpoint = @credentials.auth_url
deleted_lines: endpoint = nil if ENV['OS_AUTH_URL'] endpoint = ENV['OS_AUTH_URL'] else endpoint = get_os_vars_from_rcfile(rc_filename)['OS_AUTH_URL'] unless endpoint # This is from legacy but seems wrong, we want auth_url not url! endpoint = get_admin_endpoint end end

commit_message:
Changed fuel2 utility to support network template as file

Example of CLI call:

fuel2 network-template upload --file /tmp/test-file 1

Change-Id: I3b2a6b4bdb47e4135a9e808b47335ca73e004f44
Closes-Bug: #1483761
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-fuelclient refs/changes/06/212906/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def upload_network_template(self, environment_id, directory=None, file_path=None): directory=directory, file_path=file_path)

commit_message:
Add get/set boot mode to Management Interface

This blueprint is to add new functions get_boot_mode,set_boot_mode
to management Interface to get the current boot mode and to set the
boot mode for the next boot respectively.

Change-Id: I7827abe09dc4f1889499091b5b4772de832af58e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/29/129529/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================= Add get/set boot mode to Management Interface ============================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/add-boot-mode-mgmt-interface This blueprint is to add new functions get_boot_mode, get_supported_boot_modes, set_boot_mode to management Interface to get the current boot mode and supported boot modes of a node and to set the boot mode for the next boot respectively. Problem description =================== Today, Ironic has a capability to boot a node in either BIOS/UEFI boot mode. It is useful for the operator to have a capability to get and set the boot mode for a baremetal node. Proposed change =============== * The following abstract functions to be added to ManagementInterface- .. code-block:: python def set_boot_mode(self, task, boot_mode): """ Sets the node to boot using boot_mode for the next boot. :param task: a task from TaskManager. :param boot_mode: Next boot mode. """ def get_boot_mode(self, task): """ Get current boot mode for a node. :param task: a task from TaskManager. """ def get_supported_boot_modes(self, task): """ Get the supported boot modes of a node. :param task: a task from TaskManager. """ * REST API changes to support the functionalities. * ironic node-get-boot-mode , ironic node-set-boot-mode and ironic-node-get-supported-boot-modes command line interface will be created for the above functions. * Currently, IPMI doesn't support get/set boot mode. Other vendor specific drivers can use the interface. * IPMI drivers to raise UnsupportedDriverExtension exception. * iscsi_ilo, agent_ilo and pxe_ilo drivers to implement the interface. Alternatives ------------ Continue to use via vendorPassThru

commit_message:
Fix to set value for name using nova list --fields option

You can see blank value for name when you use nova list --fields
Name,Networks.

This problem persists because name field is considered as a filter
formatter. This was not working when rendering the name in print
list function of utility file.

Change-Id: I7e0ef23d23488e4ac0282184f759ea5a1bdf6dc0
Closes-Bug: #1473399

commit_message:
Make ComputeNode.service_id nullable to match db schema

The compute_node table was recently updated to make service_id column
nullable[1]. This mirrors that change to the ComputeNode object.

[1] 551be2c52a29cb2755de4825a3fcb2c8f7d7b3f1

Change-Id: I54e81fe7662039d4bf51babcbd2a0d597f98377a
Related-Bug: #1438189

commit_message:
Remove test 'deploy_heat_ha_one_controller_nova'

Since 'deploy_heat_ha_one_controller_nova' test was marked with
enabled=False, so it is became unneeded and can be deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1478920

Change-Id: Ie788095a1e6097f952bc5db6ad51aa56c5e595db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/34/211234/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: @test(enabled=False, depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_3], groups=["deploy_heat_ha_one_controller_nova"]) @log_snapshot_after_test def deploy_heat_ha_one_controller_nova(self): """Deploy Heat cluster in ha mode with Nova Network Scenario: 1. Create cluster 2. Add 1 node with controller role and mongo 3. Add 1 nodes with compute role 4. Set Ceilometer install option 5. Deploy the cluster 6. Verify Heat, Ceilometer services 7. Run OSTF platform tests Duration 40m Snapshot: deploy_heat_ha_one_controller_nova """ self.env.revert_snapshot("ready_with_3_slaves") data = { 'ceilometer': True, 'tenant': 'heatSimple', 'user': 'heatSimple', 'password': 'heatSimple' } cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, mode=settings.DEPLOYMENT_MODE, settings=data) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, { 'slave-01': ['controller', 'mongo'], 'slave-02': ['compute'] } ) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) os_conn = os_actions.OpenStackActions( self.fuel_web.get_public_vip(cluster_id), data['user'], data['password'], data['tenant']) self.fuel_web.assert_cluster_ready( os_conn, smiles_count=6, networks_count=1, timeout=300) _ip = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_node_by_name("slave-01")['ip'] checkers.verify_service( self.env.d_env.get_ssh_to_remote(_ip), service_name='heat-api', count=3) _ip = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_node_by_name("slave-01")['ip'] checkers.verify_service( self.env.d_env.get_ssh_to_remote(_ip), service_name='ceilometer-api') LOGGER.debug('Run Heat OSTF platform tests') test_class_main = ('fuel_health.tests.tests_platform.' 'test_heat.' 'HeatSmokeTests') tests_names = ['test_actions', 'test_advanced_actions', 'test_autoscaling', 'test_rollback', 'test_update'] test_classes = [] for test_name in tests_names: test_classes.append('{0}.{1}'.format(test_class_main, test_name)) for test_name in test_classes: self.fuel_web.run_single_ostf_test( cluster_id=cluster_id, test_sets=['tests_platform'], test_name=test_name, timeout=60 * 60) self.env.make_snapshot("deploy_heat_ha_one_controller_nova")

commit_message:
Incorrect command output

message:
It contains unnecessary backslash (\) for the command output.

Change-Id: Ib9ab65277fdfade496e5af5a6f33a02eb92a9a97
Closes-Bug: #1486346

commit_message:
Keep cleaning_updated_at updated during cleaning

When the node starts or continue to be cleaned the cleaning_updated_at
field should be updated.

Partial-Bug: #1483120
Change-Id: I574cfba7caab9fac776748ec39983aba40b7a0ca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/98/213698/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @abc.abstractmethod def touch_node_cleaning(self, node_id): """Mark the node's cleaning as running. Mark the node's cleaning as running by updating its 'cleaning_updated_at' property. :param node_id: The id of a node. :raises: NodeNotFound """

commit_message:
Add network templates support for network verification

If network template is attached to cluster it should be used
in the network verification task to prepare list of network
interfaces, that will be used for network connectivity
verification.

Change-Id: I7b37033405b12790e71f3fcd72b6b40083aec9c3
Closes-Bug: #1481649

added_lines: import collections def get_ifaces_from_network_template(self, node, node_json): templates_for_node_mapping = \ node.network_template['templates_for_node_role'] node_templates = set() for role_name in node.all_roles: node_templates.update(templates_for_node_mapping[role_name]) bonds = {} ifaces = collections.defaultdict(list) templates = node.network_template['templates'] for template_name in node_templates: template = templates[template_name] transformations = template['transformations'] for transformation in transformations: if transformation['action'] == 'add-port': ifname = transformation['name'] vlan = 0 chunks = ifname.rsplit('.', 1) if len(chunks) == 2: ifname, vlan = chunks ifaces[ifname].append(int(vlan)) elif transformation['action'] == 'add-bond': if transformation['mode'] == consts.BOND_MODES.l_802_3ad: node_json['excluded_networks'].append( transformation['name']) else: bonds[transformation['name']] = sorted( transformation['interfaces']) for if_name, vlans in six.iteritems(ifaces): node_json.append({ 'iface': if_name, 'vlans': sorted(vlans) }) if bonds: node_json['bonds'] = bonds def get_ifaces_on_undeployed_node(self, node, node_json, has_public): logger.info('>>> GET_IFACES_ON_UNDEPLOYED_NODE {0}'.format( repr(node.network_template))) if node.network_template: self.get_ifaces_from_network_template(node, node_json) return

commit_message:
Added options to enable SSL for noVNC proxy

Added required options to enable SSL for noVNC proxy service when configuring
the dashboard for HTTPS.

Change-Id: I8b2cafe1186c569d7c9b1f0f152fb8a9daf5d597
Closes-Bug: 1481972
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/91/214391/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Configuring the dashboard for HTTPS will also require enabling SSL for the noVNC proxy service. On the controller node, add the following additional options to the [DEFAULT] section of the /etc/nova/nova.conf file: [DEFAULT] ... ssl_only = true cert = /etc/apache2/SSL/openstack.example.com.crt key = /etc/apache2/SSL/openstack.example.com.key On the compute nodes, ensure the nonvncproxy_base_url option points to a URL with an HTTPS scheme: [DEFAULT] ... novncproxy_base_url = https://controller:6080/vnc_auto.html

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-19 17:24:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-calico/commit/388c8d1f59f8b738aa157128677bcfeec7507c7c', 'message': "Add interface driver for DHCP for routed networking

This change adds an interface driver that combines with the reference
Neutron DHCP agent to provide DHCP service to unbridged TAP interfaces
on the local compute host.  This is what is needed when using a
'routed' network implementation [1] in which data to and from VMs is
routed on the compute host instead of being bridged.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/198439/

Use of this interface driver should be triggered by the following
settings in one of the config files that the DHCP agent reads.

    interface_driver = networking_calico.interface.RoutedInterfaceDriver
    use_namespaces = False

Key points of its implementation are as follows.

- Everything is done in the default namespace.

- The DHCP agent invokes Dnsmasq with modified options, notably
  '--bridge-interface=ns-XXX,tap* --interface=tap*', that tell Dnsmasq

  are defined.

  interface.

- The ns-XXX interface is given the subnet's gateway IP address,
  instead of a freshly allocated IP address from the subnet.

- The on-link route for the subnet, which Linux creates automatically,
  must be deleted, since other addresses on that subnet are not in
  fact available via the dummy device.

commit_message:
Add interface driver for DHCP for routed networking

This change adds an interface driver that combines with the reference
Neutron DHCP agent to provide DHCP service to unbridged TAP interfaces
on the local compute host.  This is what is needed when using a
'routed' network implementation [1] in which data to and from VMs is
routed on the compute host instead of being bridged.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/198439/

Use of this interface driver should be triggered by the following
settings in one of the config files that the DHCP agent reads.

    interface_driver = networking_calico.interface.RoutedInterfaceDriver
    use_namespaces = False

Key points of its implementation are as follows.

- Everything is done in the default namespace.

- The DHCP agent invokes Dnsmasq with modified options, notably
  '--bridge-interface=ns-XXX,tap* --interface=tap*', that tell Dnsmasq
  to listen on all the TAP interfaces and to treat those interfaces as
  aliases of the ns-XXX interface where the DHCP context and IP subnet
  are defined.

- The ns-XXX interface (for the DHCP port) is created as a dummy
  interface.

- The ns-XXX interface is given the subnet's gateway IP address,
  instead of a freshly allocated IP address from the subnet.

- The on-link route for the subnet, which Linux creates automatically,
  must be deleted, since other addresses on that subnet are not in
  fact available via the dummy device.

Change-Id: I0f237bc999e43522ad83e6d652f53068b7e9733c
Partial-Bug: #1472704
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-calico refs/changes/21/214721/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Metaswitch Networks # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import netaddr from neutron.agent.linux import interface from neutron.agent.linux import ip_lib from neutron.common import exceptions class RoutedInterfaceDriver(interface.LinuxInterfaceDriver): """Driver for DHCP service for routed virtual interfaces.""" DEV_NAME_PREFIX = 'ns-' def __init__(self, conf): super(RoutedInterfaceDriver, self).__init__(conf) # Require use_namespaces to be False. Routed networking does # not use namespaces. if self.conf.use_namespaces: raise exceptions.InvalidConfigurationOption( opt_name='use_namespaces', opt_value='True' ) @property def use_gateway_ips(self): # Routed networking does not bridge across compute hosts or # network nodes, so the DHCP port can use the gateway IP # address of each subnet for which it is handing out # addresses, instead of requiring a fresh Neutron-allocated IP # address. return True def plug_new(self, network_id, port_id, device_name, mac_address, bridge=None, namespace=None, prefix=None): """Plugin the interface.""" ip = ip_lib.IPWrapper() # Create dummy interface (in the default namespace). ns_dummy = ip.add_dummy(device_name) ns_dummy.link.set_address(mac_address) if self.conf.network_device_mtu: ns_dummy.link.set_mtu(self.conf.network_device_mtu) ns_dummy.link.set_up() def init_l3(self, device_name, ip_cidrs, namespace=None, preserve_ips=[], gateway=None, extra_subnets=[]): """Extend LinuxInterfaceDriver.init_l3 to remove the subnet route(s) that Linux automatically creates. """ super(RoutedInterfaceDriver, self).init_l3(device_name, ip_cidrs, namespace, preserve_ips, gateway, extra_subnets) device = ip_lib.IPDevice(device_name, namespace=namespace) device.set_log_fail_as_error(False) for ip_cidr in ip_cidrs: LOG.debug("Remove subnet route for cidr %s" % ip_cidr) net = netaddr.IPNetwork(ip_cidr) LOG.debug("=> real cidr %s" % net.cidr) try: device.route.delete_onlink_route(net.cidr) except RuntimeError: LOG.debug("Subnet route %s did not exist" % net.cidr) def unplug(self, device_name, bridge=None, namespace=None, prefix=None): """Unplug the interface.""" device = ip_lib.IPDevice(device_name, namespace) try: device.link.delete() LOG.debug(_("Unplugged interface '%s'"), device_name) except RuntimeError: LOG.error(_("Failed unplugging interface '%s'"), device_name) def dnsmasq_bind_options(self, device_name): # The DHCP port and VM TAP interfaces are not bridged, so # change the dnsmasq invocation as follows. # --interface=tap* # to listen on all TAP interfaces # --bind-dynamic instead of --bind-interfaces, to # automatically start listening on new TAP # interfaces as they appear # --bridge-interface=%s,tap* # to treat all TAP # interfaces as aliases of the DHCP port. return [ '--bind-dynamic', '--interface=%s' % device_name, '--interface=tap*', '--bridge-interface=%s,tap*' % device_name, ]

commit_message:
post_test_hook is not executed when the gate test returns an error

Even if the gate test returns an error, we may need to get an error info.
This patch adds a new hook entitled post_test_error_hook is executed in
a case of the gate test error.

Change-Id: Ib3b21d9ec9dce840163f48c067e5329407aa72d3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/63/148863/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ $GATE_RETVAL -ne 0 ] && function_exists "post_test_error_hook"; then echo "Running post_test_error_hook" xtrace=$(set +o | grep xtrace) set -o xtrace -o pipefail tsfilter post_test_error_hook | tee $WORKSPACE/devstack-gate-post-test-error-hook.txt RETVAL=$? sudo mv $WORKSPACE/devstack-gate-post-test-error-hook.txt $BASE/logs/ set +o pipefail $xtrace fi

commit_message:
Add cleaning_updated_at in the Nodes database

This patch is adding a new column for the Nodes database model called
'cleaning_updated_at'. This field is intent to keep track of last time
cleaning was updated so that a timeout mechanism for the cleaning
operation can be implemented.

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded IDs from NetworkGroup objects in net check test

The IDs of objects created in test_check_untagged_intersection_failed
are no longer hardcoded. They will instead use the next value of the
ID column sequence. This prevents conflicts between transient and
persistent objects in the SQLalchemy session as they will no longer
have the same identifier.

Change-Id: Ifaa3b2e3dfe950ef4b08fa6eb9f8217062ceca9d
Closes-bug: #1484936

commit_message:
Add --may-exist to l3_agent recipe

when external_network_bridge is not empty, and has been created in formal
deployment operation, at this time the external_network_interface should has
been added to the external_network_bridge, so if we run a update operation
on l3 agent recipe, it will try to add the interface to the bridge again,
that will return an error, add --may-exist to avoid it.

Change-Id: I40dabc862ae12dc4be81b196987b692a34c0c6c9
Partial-Bug: 1483994

commit_message:
Override api_extensions_path in unit tests

In order to be able to implement unit tests for FWaaS, the extension
path must be set to the midonet's in setup.  The reason is that FWaaS
puts its extension path twice, one in the CONF override and one
inserted by Neutron separately because it's a well-known advanced
service.  This is usually not a problem because one of the duplicated
paths gets removed when Neutron starts, but this dedup logic fails as
soon as you append a different extension path, causing Neutron to fail
to start.  This patch sets the extension path of the midonet plugin in
the test setup so that any duplicated paths that might exist in CONF
get overwritten completely.

Partially-implements:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/networking-midonet/+spec/midonet-fwaas
Signed-off-by: Ryu Ishimoto <ryu@midokura.com>

Change-Id: I8e5d7c8d7ee793f63346fe856e782c22d829dfe4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/19/214919/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from midonet.neutron import extensions as m_extextensions_path = m_ext.__path__[0] # Override with the midonet extension path. This is needed because in # some projects' tests, (FWaaS, for example) two entries of the same # path may get registered. It then relies on the # get_extensions_path method to remove the duplicate. But when midonet # plugin appends its own extension path, the dedup logic fails and # causes the tests to fail to load. By always setting the extension # path here, it removes the duplicate extension paths by making # midonet extension path the only one registered. Projects such as # FWaaS and LBaaS get their extension paths inserted by neutron # differently, and their paths do not need to be overridden in CONF. cfg.CONF.set_override('api_extensions_path', extensions_path)

commit_message:
Load ip_vs module for keepalived

If ip_vs is not loaded keepalived will enter a restart loop.  To fix that
load ip_vs module every time we start the container.

Change-Id: I6b39d8654cc6a6da7a9162e5c3efab073746b246
Closes-Bug: #1486276

commit_message:
Updating cert_parser for cert loading

Will now load certificates with the provided cert manager.

This allows multilple driver implementations to reuse code
in regards to loading the certificate data from the certificate
manager, e.g. Barbican cert manager.

Change-Id: Id20acf49753c3f75b4152d351412e93394e72b17
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/35/208035/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: config = self.jinja.build_config(listener, certs['tls_cert']) certs = cert_parser.load_certificates_data(self.barbican_client, listener) if certs['tls_cert'] is not None: data.append(cert_parser.build_pem(certs['tls_cert'])) if certs['sni_certs']: data.append(cert_parser.build_pem(certs['sni_certs'])) return certs
deleted_lines: from octavia.common import data_models as data_models config = self.jinja.build_config(listener, certs['tls_cert'], certs['sni_certs']) tls_cert = None sni_certs = [] if listener.tls_certificate_id: tls_cert = self._map_cert_tls_container( self.barbican_client.get_cert(listener.tls_certificate_id)) data.append(self._build_pem(tls_cert)) if listener.sni_containers: for sni_cont in listener.sni_containers: bbq_container = self._map_cert_tls_container( self.barbican_client.get_cert(sni_cont.tls_container.id)) sni_certs.append(bbq_container) data.append(self._build_pem(bbq_container)) return {'tls_cert': tls_cert, 'sni_certs': sni_certs} def _get_primary_cn(self, tls_cert): """Returns primary CN for Certificate.""" return cert_parser.get_host_names(tls_cert.get_certificate())['cn'] def _map_cert_tls_container(self, cert): return data_models.TLSContainer( primary_cn=self._get_primary_cn(cert), private_key=cert.get_private_key(), certificate=cert.get_certificate(), intermediates=cert.get_intermediates()) def _build_pem(self, tls_cert): """Concatenate TLS Certificate fields to create a PEM encoded certificate file """ # TODO(ptoohill): Maybe this should be part of utils or manager? pem = tls_cert.intermediates[:] pem.extend([tls_cert.certificate, tls_cert.private_key]) return "\n".join(pem)

commit_message:
Add ironic to CLIClient

Add possibility to execute ironic commands with
ironic python client.

Change-Id: I89e91d3cec56696d597819b08055ddd33a59d115
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest-lib refs/changes/14/214614/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def ironic(self, action, flags='', params='', fail_ok=False, endpoint_type='publicURL', merge_stderr=False): """Executes ironic command for the given action. :param action: the cli command to run using ironic :type action: string :param flags: any optional cli flags to use :type flags: string :param params: any optional positional args to use :type params: string :param fail_ok: if True an exception is not raised when the cli return code is non-zero :type fail_ok: boolean :param endpoint_type: the type of endpoint for the service :type endpoint_type: string :param merge_stderr: if True the stderr buffer is merged into stdout :type merge_stderr: boolean """ flags += ' --os-endpoint-type %s' % endpoint_type return self.cmd_with_auth( 'ironic', action, flags, params, fail_ok, merge_stderr)

commit_message:
Fix binary builds for oraclelinux templates

* Enable some extra repos for oraclelinux in the base template.

* Disable magnum binary builds for oraclelinux due to unavailable
  python-docker-py dependency

Change-Id: Iaf8826dc0f9ff93a40e5ad3d1c0fd1fb6ef2e048
Closes-Bug: 1486636

Purely cosmetic change on keystone provider

Reordering methods (and class methods) in alphabetical order for better
readability and anticipating coming changes.

commit_message:
Set 'ip_ranges' notation for cluster networks

Since 'fuel-devops' allocates 1st IP of each network
for 'router', tests must set exact IP ranges which can
be used for environment. Otherwise 1st network IP could
be allocated for environment needs if gateway isn't used
in that network.

Change-Id: I215bbbe73685affd598daf50d6900cb166a06c69
Closes-bug: #1486759

commit_message:
Improve the performance of get evacuated instances from a host which should be destroyed

When destory the evacuated instances from a host,it need to get the host's instance which are found on the hypervisor.
If the driver doesn't support uuids listing, it will get all the instances on openstack.
So we use evacuate instance's uuid which were evacuated from current host to filter the instance.

Closes-Bug: #1486026

Change-Id: I132eaf24c2243074dd9122041fb4feb0733e4737
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/40/214540/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: filters = {'deleted': False,'uuid': [mig.instance_uuid for mig in evacuations]}

commit_message:
Move experimental scenario gate jobs for Sahara to non-voting check

We've tested that jobs works okay and now we'd like to monitor how
this jobs will be working for all change requests. After some
period of time when we'll be sure that jobs works stable enough and
correctly, we'll make them voting (and add to gate pipeline too).

Change-Id: I322a330ff6e458a3de4d4bd5b8584e8f72814950

commit_message:
Enable debug logging for Nova, Glance, Cinder requests

Currently requests to these services are not logged with debug=True
config option by default. This makes debugging difficult.

Also set default log level for keystoneclient.auth to WARN, because it
floods logs with useless info.

Change-Id: Idfe2684b4146bb3c44159a08572e3c0eeff85f5f

commit_message:
Check size limitation in cluster scale in/out action

We should check cluster size limitation before doing size adjusment
in scale_in and scale_out action. This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: Ief0358c7a63bdae83af3f54b500c07162aae9bf2

commit_message:
Make pagination tolerate a deleted marker

Currently, Nova does not paginate correctly if the marker is
a deleted server. When trying to get servers with such a
marker, a "BadRequest" error saying that the marker is
not found will be raised.

We now always pass read_deleted=yes if a marker is being used.

Change-Id: I79a1fb79a38ac4006db622590574308aafdcb5b5
Closes-bug: #1481812
Related-Bug: #1398086

added_lines: from nailgun import dbfrom nailgun.db.sqlalchemy.models import Task try: if 'networks' in data: self.validator.validate_networks_update( jsonutils.dumps(data) ) if 'networking_parameters' in data: self.validator.validate_neutron_params( jsonutils.dumps(data), cluster_id=cluster_id ) objects.Cluster.get_network_manager( cluster ).update(cluster, data) except Exception as exc: # set task status to error and update its corresponding data task = Task( name=consts.TASK_NAMES.check_networks, cluster=cluster, status=consts.TASK_STATUSES.error, progress=100, message=six.text_type(exc) ) db.db().add(task) db.db().commit() logger.error(traceback.format_exc()) self.raise_task(task)
deleted_lines: if task.status != consts.TASK_STATUSES.error: try: if 'networks' in data: self.validator.validate_networks_update( jsonutils.dumps(data) ) if 'networking_parameters' in data: self.validator.validate_neutron_params( jsonutils.dumps(data), cluster_id=cluster_id ) objects.Cluster.get_network_manager( cluster ).update(cluster, data) except Exception as exc: # set task status to error and update its corresponding data data = {'status': 'error', 'progress': 100, 'message': six.text_type(exc)} objects.Task.update(task, data) logger.error(traceback.format_exc())

added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2015-08-19 06:30+0000\n" "PO-Revision-Date: 2015-08-20 01:30+0000\n""This functionality is an important piece of the puzzle when it comes to live " "upgrades and is conceptually similar to the existing API versioning that " "allows OpenStack services of different versions to communicate without " "issue, for example Grizzly Compute can still make Grizzly Identity API calls " "even if Identity is running Icehouse." msgstr "" "この機能は、ライブアップグレードするということになると、パズルの重要な部品に" "なります。異なるバージョンの OpenStack サービスが問題なく通信できるようにする" "ために、既存の API バージョンと概念的に同じになります。例えば、Identity が " "Icehouse を動作させている場合でも、Grizzly Compute が Grizzly Identity API を" "呼び出せます。" msgid ""
