Change-Id: Ia86928e3803009b680cb366a3dd41de98359842b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/07/200307/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Custom HardwareManagers and Cleaning ------------------------------------ One of the reasons to build a custom hardware manager is to expose extra steps in `Ironic Cleaning`[4]_. A node will perform a list of cleaning steps any time the node is deleted by a tenant or moved from MANAGEABLE state to AVAILABLE state. If the node is using a *_agent driver, Ironic will query IPA for a list of clean steps that should be executed on the node. IPA will dispatch a call to `get_clean_steps()` on all available hardware managers and then return the combined list to Ironic. To expose extra clean steps, the custom hardware manager should have a function named `get_clean_steps()` which returns a list of dictionaries. The dictionaries should be in the form:: { // A function on the custom hardware manager 'step': 'upgrade_firmware', // An integer priority. Largest priorities are executed first 'priority': 10, // Should always be the deploy interface 'interface': 'deploy', // Request the node to be rebooted out of band by Ironic when the // step completes successfully 'reboot_requested': False } Then, you should create functions which match each of the `step` keys in the clean steps you return. The functions will take two parameters: `node`, a dictionary representation of the Ironic node, and `ports`, a list of dictionary representations of the Ironic ports attached to `node`. When a clean step is executed in IPA, the `step` key will be sent to the hardware managers in hardware support order, using `hardware.dispatch_to_managers()`. For each hardware manager, if the manager has a function matching the `step` key, it will be executed. If the function returns a value, that value is returned to Ironic and no further managers are called. If the manager raises `IncompatibleHardwareMethodError`, the next manager will be called. An example step:: def upgrade_firmware(self, node, ports): if self._device_exists(): # Do the upgrade return 'upgraded firmware' else: raise errors.IncompatibleHardwareMethodError() Note: If two managers return steps with the same `step` key, the priority will be set to whichever manager has a higher hardware support level and then use the higher priority in the case of a tie. string; any version change whatsoever will induce cleaning to restart.`evaluate_hardware_support()` on each hardware manager. This method should return an int representing hardware manager priority, based on what it detects about the platform its running on. Suggested values are included in the.. [4] Ironic Cleaning - http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/deploy/cleaning.html

commit_message:
Allow CPU/RAM overcommit when using NUMATopologyFilter

When using the NUMATopologyFilter, it doesn't make sense to entirely
prevent overcommit just because NUMA is involved.

This removes an overzealous check so that we still allow CPU and RAM
to be overcommitted even when NUMA is in play

Partial-Bug: #1484742
Change-Id: I896f67a25f6673dbebf46fd07e6fce8f1c2208c3

commit_message:
Fix docs translation import errors

When building docs, there are a ton of errors in this format:

AppRegistryNotReady: The translation infrastructure cannot be
initialized before the apps registry is ready. Check that you don't make
non-lazy gettext calls at import time.

Starting in Django 1.7, standalone scripts, such as a sphinx build
require that django.setup() be called first. See:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.8/releases/1.7/#standalone-scripts

This should be added to the horizon/docs/source/conf.py

Doing so eliminates the errors.

Closes-Bug: #1486139
Change-Id: I0871be3d60d4d78cb430fabdb5725832559191d7

commit_message:
Ironic: Create nodes with names

This patch is setting a name for each node created in Ironic, when
testing stuff it's easier to refer to a nome by its name then uuid.

The format of the name is: node-0, node-1, ...

Change-Id: I60fcddbcb36d1b1da8b3846b6edf14c59401f102

commit_message:
Add MySQL-Python back in as the default.

And provide an optional reference to pymysql.
Similar change has been added to the security-doc (or will be).

Co-Authored-By: Jeremy Stanley <fungi@yuggoth.org>

Change-Id: Ib7e6580c830c701dc3716861fe2f1f6592d65575

commit_message:
jenkins/puppet: add missing builders to integration job

To be consistent with Beaker jobs, we need to enabling local root access
and clean the node of any previous Puppet install.

That means adding 2 builders that are already used by other Puppet jobs:
* puppet-prepare-node
* allow-local-ssh-root

Change-Id: Ib1a006fbbe5252c3642187d7be4f857134cc7558
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/16/214716/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - puppet-prepare-node - allow-local-ssh-root

commit_message:
Use the executor directly in notifier

Instead of going through taskflow, use the executor directly in the
notifier, so that task execution doesn't block the pipeline and the main
loop when running.

Change-Id: I8cc555494d1d40ec7521046ce1b4a28b9b85e0ba

subject: Fix libvirt plugin bug for newly created VMs

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-19 18:04:41.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/libvirt.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent/commit/2fbc40b918956747f36b24fef6e70bee5f884532', 'message': 'Fix libvirt plugin bug for newly created VMs

Once the instance cache file is built, we can never refresh the
cache because we get a TypeError trying to build the dimensions
and mis-diagnose the VM as a ghost VM.  Simple fix is to move
the update cache call above where we look for the instance name
in the cache.

commit_message:
Fix libvirt plugin bug for newly created VMs

Once the instance cache file is built, we can never refresh the
cache because we get a TypeError trying to build the dimensions
and mis-diagnose the VM as a ghost VM.  Simple fix is to move
the update cache call above where we look for the instance name
in the cache.

Change-Id: Iddc229a4e0f150e838a82ace36bc1ba92be17a0e
Closes-Bug: #1486688
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/36/214736/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if inst_name not in instance_cache: instance_cache = self._update_instance_cache()
deleted_lines: if inst_name not in instance_cache: instance_cache = self._update_instance_cache()

commit_message:
l3_odl: put request for remove_interface, not delete

remove_interface requires PUT method, not DELETE method.
Thus remove_interface results in internal server error.

Closes-Bug: #1485800
Change-Id: I9c1b6efc8343cc5256dcaa7a35c5c9771fa98479
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/31/213931/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.client.sendjson('put', url, router_dict)

commit_message:
Conditionally expose "last_seen_up" in service list

When using the servicegroup DB driver, whether or not the service
is up is now determined by the "last_seen_up" field, not the
"updated_at" field.  Exposing the "last_seen_up" field will make
it clear why the service is considered "down".

DocImpact
APIImpact
When the DB servicegroup driver is used and the compute node has
reported its state at least once, and the client asks for the
appropriate API microversion, this will result in a new
"last_seen_up" property being added to the information for that
compute node when issuing a GET on /v2/{tenant-id}/os-services

Implements blueprint expose-last-seen-up-listing-services

Related-Bug: #1420848
Change-Id: I2294dfb54c18afeeddfcea755d64e1e1fad2c23d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/18/168418/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - **2.4** Exposes additional "last_seen_up" attribute to os-services to give a more accurate view of service status. The "updated_at" attribute can be spuriously updated by the end-user doing a "service disable" followed by a "service enable". The "last_seen_up" attribute shows the last time the service explicitly reported its state, and so is a more accurate view of the health of the service.

commit_message:
[network-guide] Update L3 HA scenarios

Update L3 HA scenarios as follows:

1) Rename scenario files and adjust titles accordingly.
2) Add HA project network to diagrams.
3) Update diagrams to improve consistency and clarity.
4) Clarify failover process content.
5) Add step to launch an example instance.
6) Add validation steps for floating IP address.
7) Replace tenant with project.

Closes-Bug: #1465778
Partial-Bug: #1465783
Change-Id: Ieeb2726301dab45876cca3e2161c6230af232bcb

commit_message:
Add volume type support to Datera

This allows created volumes to have a volume type specified with them.

Implements: blueprint datera-extra-spec-support
Implements: blueprint datera-qos-support
Change-Id: I217d75deecbbf2282125703c296dc524174c4660

added_lines: from cinder.volume import volume_types @mock.patch.object(volume_types, 'get_volume_type') def test_create_volume_with_extra_specs(self, mock_get_type): self.mock_api.return_value = { u'status': u'available', u'name': u'volume-00000001', u'parent': u'00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000', u'uuid': u'c20aba21-6ef6-446b-b374-45733b4883ba', u'snapshots': {}, u'targets': {}, u'num_replicas': u'2', u'sub_type': u'IS_ORIGINAL', u'size': u'1073741824' } mock_get_type.return_value = { 'name': u'The Best', 'qos_specs_id': None, 'deleted': False, 'created_at': '2015-08-14 04:18:11', 'updated_at': None, 'extra_specs': { u'volume_backend_name': u'datera', u'qos:max_iops_read': u'2000', u'qos:max_iops_write': u'4000', u'qos:max_iops_total': u'4000' }, 'is_public': True, 'deleted_at': None, 'id': u'dffb4a83-b8fb-4c19-9f8c-713bb75db3b1', 'description': None } mock_volume = _stub_volume( volume_type_id='dffb4a83-b8fb-4c19-9f8c-713bb75db3b1' ) assert_body = { u'max_iops_read': u'2000', 'numReplicas': '2', 'uuid': u'c20aba21-6ef6-446b-b374-45733b4883ba', 'size': '1073741824', u'max_iops_write': u'4000', u'max_iops_total': u'4000', 'name': u'volume-00000001' } self.assertIsNone(self.driver.create_volume(mock_volume)) self.mock_api.assert_called_once_with('volumes', 'post', body=assert_body) self.assertTrue(mock_get_type.called) volume['volume_type_id'] = kwargs.get('volume_type_id', None)

commit_message:
Implement SoftwareComponent and WebApplication normative types

Add support for translating TOSCA normative types
tosca.nodes.SoftwareComponent and tosca.nodes.WebApplication
and added unit tests for them.

Change-Id: I4b2bf955b5ca5181fc0021cd5633722cd449fbc6
Closes-Bug: #1479132

subject: Don't force package upgrades when running tox
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-10 15:03:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/8bf1940819a9e622b7460485227c0623a9c2c80a', 'message': "Don't force package upgrades when running tox

This essentially reverts change
If5c4e12956f2c7be6530c5c9a57fdfb1da8e710c .

Currently, tox.ini contains the line:

install_command = pip install -U --force-reinstall {opts} {packages}

This causes a serious headscratcher for anybody running:

  tox --sitepackages

In the above case, the user intends to test in a virtualenv using
system packages where available. However, this setting prevents this
from working, as it will force upgrade them anyway.

The justification for the original commit includes 'this ensures that
the latest packages are installed'. This isn't correct behaviour. If a
particular version of a package is insufficient, the correct solution
is to bump its version requirement in requirements.txt.

The other justification was that the latest oslo packages should be
used. Tox should not be using system packages at all if 'sitepackages'
has not been set, so this should not be a consideration. i.e. Somebody
running 'tox --sitepackages' where oslo packages are installed would
expect the site packages to be used, but currently they are not.
Somebody running tox without '--sitepackages' would expect a new
package to be pulled down, which should have been the case without the
above change, anyway.

Change-Id: I5a47ddb9f8a67ceb1904cbc24e2a61f04d1ba1de
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-17 12:15:23.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0b556483dc5b8121e48da9be537500582024b82d', 'message': "Don't force package upgrades when running tox

commit_message:
Don't force package upgrades when running tox

This essentially reverts change
If5c4e12956f2c7be6530c5c9a57fdfb1da8e710c .

Currently, tox.ini contains the line:

install_command = pip install -U --force-reinstall {opts} {packages}

This causes a serious headscratcher for anybody running:

  tox --sitepackages

In the above case, the user intends to test in a virtualenv using
system packages where available. However, this setting prevents this
from working, as it will force upgrade them anyway.

The justification for the original commit includes 'this ensures that
the latest packages are installed'. This isn't correct behaviour. If a
particular version of a package is insufficient, the correct solution
is to bump its version requirement in requirements.txt.

The other justification was that the latest oslo packages should be
used. Tox should not be using system packages at all if 'sitepackages'
has not been set, so this should not be a consideration. i.e. Somebody
running 'tox --sitepackages' where oslo packages are installed would
expect the site packages to be used, but currently they are not.
Somebody running tox without '--sitepackages' would expect a new
package to be pulled down, which should have been the case without the
above change, anyway.

Change-Id: I5a47ddb9f8a67ceb1904cbc24e2a61f04d1ba1de

subject: Add non-model index names to autogen exclude filters
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-17 21:44:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/46d86dbb836fde537e1257b1a9d57fbad52a7632', 'message': "Add non-model index names to autogen exclude filters

These two indexes are part of the Alembic migrations which take
place only for MySQL, however there is no corresponding
Index() object in the model such that autogenerate would
know that these aren't removed.  Ensure they are considered by
the include_object filter so that autogenerate does not
include that these seem to be removed.

Change-Id: I49abb3f7ad9731cde046fa2862cdb9ec16c3aeb3
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-18 15:01:48.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/migration/__init__.py', 'neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/env.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/c32f937cf0f345d073573b0d1b935e320c8765d4', 'message': "Add non-model index names to autogen exclude filters

These two indexes are part of the Alembic migrations which take
place only for MySQL, however there is no corresponding
Index() object in the model such that autogenerate would
know that these aren't removed.  Ensure they are considered by
the include_object filter so that autogenerate does not
include that these seem to be removed.

(rebase)

Change-Id: I49abb3f7ad9731cde046fa2862cdb9ec16c3aeb3
"}]
commit_message:
Add non-model index names to autogen exclude filters

These two indexes are part of the Alembic migrations which take
place only for MySQL, however there is no corresponding
Index() object in the model such that autogenerate would
know that these aren't removed.  Ensure they are considered by
the include_object filter so that autogenerate does not
include that these seem to be removed.

(rebase)

Change-Id: I49abb3f7ad9731cde046fa2862cdb9ec16c3aeb3

commit_message:
Implement expand/contract autogenerate extension

Makes use of new Alembic 0.8 features to allow
altering of the "alembic revision" stream such
that operations for expand and contract are
directed into separate branches.

Change-Id: Ifa743e2f5b90e59a8de8f4e7a67c4bbe46686804

commit_message:
DVR: fix router scheduling

Fix scheduling of DVR routers to not stop scheduling once
csnat portion was scheduled. See bug report for failing
scenario.

This partially reverts
commit 3794b4a83e68041e24b715135f0ccf09a5631178
and fixes bug 1374473 by moving csnat scheduling
after general dvr router scheduling, so double binding does
not happen.

Closes-Bug: #1472163
Related-Bug: #1374473
Change-Id: I57c06e2be732e47b6cce7c724f6b255ea2d8fa32

commit_message:
Add the resp to RestClientExceptions

This gives us access to a resp attribute on any RestClientExceptions
raised during requests made by the RestClient

Change-Id: I79eace93e7080de64fa53399ba14ee131cd3a7ff

commit_message:
Add puppet-modulesync-configs hook

The openstack puppet team is already using modulesync manually to copy
files around, this just automates the process.

Change-Id: I1d93adb63bcbfb6dce6da5bbf1ced2180dc0b9d9
Depends-On: I8b9e7edd564e55eaba8ed95294bd185f0fe2a585
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/17/210517/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif [ "$OWN_PROJECT" == "puppet-modulesync-configs" ] ; then INITIAL_COMMIT_MSG="Updated from puppet-modulesync-configs" TOPIC="openstack/puppet-modulesync-configs" # Pretty ugly, but this should be moved to a local script. PROJECTS=$(cat managed_modules.yml | cut -d '-' -f 2,3 | grep puppet | sed 's/ //g' | sed 's/^/openstack\//g') function update { bash -xe tools/sync-projects.sh $1 }

commit_message:
Make sure 'SubnetId' update works for instance

'SubnetId' is updatable property, but now the
update doesn't works if only update 'SubnetId'
without 'NetworkInterfaces'.

Change-Id: I86a9ce608ce13931a35d2776c6df0637bb022949
Closes-Bug: #1479650

commit_message:
Rename Manila context

Make Manila context named in the same way as all existing contexts - having
resource name in context name. Also move manila-related stuff from top of
'self.context' to appropriate subcatalogs.

Change-Id: I3e8e660151d6a4c119738681b65ce42e32bdddd4

commit_message:
Fix notify_decorator errors

* getattr is built-in function, so should not be used as attribute.
* When ctxt is None, rpc.get_notifier('api').info(ctxt, name, body)
  leads NoneType exception at context.to_dict(). So we need guarantee
  one valid context here.

Closes-Bug: #1476931

Change-Id: I25953467aca641448d25b2d63352f756ec3655aa

commit_message:
Improve test coverage for nova client plugin

Recent changes have removed exiting test coverage for nova client
call to discover and load the extensions. This patch adds
them back.

Also changes aws/test_loadbalancer.py to fix
bug #1482153.

Co-Authored-By: Tony Wang <muyu@unitedstack.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pavlo Shchelokovskyy <pshchelokovskyy@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I5130bfe09073e995413779af216b4dfb2a859e4f

subject: neutron: filter None port_ids from ports list in _unbind_ports
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-27 21:56:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f64e78cbe16369c0c446564edf6555eb7ab1bce8', 'message': "neutron: filter None port_ids from ports list in _unbind_ports

The compute manager calls deallocate_for_instance with the original
requested_networks when an instance fails to build and we try to
cleanup. The port_id in the requested_networks tuple is optional, so we
can end up passing a list of ports to _unbind_ports with None in it,
which will result in a 404 back from neutron since a port with id None
does not exist. This doesn't fail the operation but it results in an
ugly stacktrace in the compute logs.

This change simply checks for None in _unbinde_ports when iterating over
the list of ports passed in.

Note that the filtering could be done in deallocate_for_instance when
building the ports_to_skip list from requested_networks, but I opted to
future proof the _unbind_ports method in case other callers forget to
filter the list passed in, and there are other callers of _unbind_ports.

Closes-Bug: #1478702

Change-Id: Ie5980be71a1d83f03ab5d232f29da7e67caf6f35

commit_message:
neutron: filter None port_ids from ports list in _unbind_ports

The compute manager calls deallocate_for_instance with the original
requested_networks when an instance fails to build and we try to
cleanup. The port_id in the requested_networks tuple is optional, so we
can end up passing a list of ports to _unbind_ports with None in it,
which will result in a 404 back from neutron since a port with id None
does not exist. This doesn't fail the operation but it results in an
ugly stacktrace in the compute logs.

This change simply checks for None in _unbind_ports when iterating over
the list of ports passed in.

Note that the filtering could be done in deallocate_for_instance when
building the ports_to_skip list from requested_networks, but I opted to
future proof the _unbind_ports method in case other callers forget to
filter the list passed in, and there are other callers of _unbind_ports.

Closes-Bug: #1478702

Change-Id: Ie5980be71a1d83f03ab5d232f29da7e67caf6f35
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/36/206236/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
libvirt: Raise error when booting from encrypted volumes

Currently, booting from an encrypted volume which contains
a whole image fails without alerting the end user to the
failure. Booting from an encrypted volume which contains a
multi-part image causes Nova to stream the image to a file
cache in the clear, essentially negating the security
benefits of the encryption. Therefore, this patch simply
prevents the user from booting from an encrypted volume and
logs an error message describing the failure.

Closes-bug: #1465656
Change-Id: I18baf6f16dc92f34f6a0b08ffff0b935e2f97c6d

commit_message:
Fix deleted markers with changed-since

When changed-since is passed, it's possible to have pagination markers
that resolve to a deleted instance. A request to this marker fails
because the query is not reading deleted instances. Fix this.

Change-Id: I5b6075a9a952ce4053a481e83e1497fb8faf6ecb

commit_message:
VMware: treat deletion exception with attached volumes

Enable the OpenStack user to successfully delete an instance that was
running on an ESX that has been removed, or the instance was deleted from
the backend VC. In the event that the instance would have an attached
volume then deleting the instance would not handle the exception
ManagedObjectNotFound.

Change-Id: I1781256bec15ed3301425e63c7a3d28dc057f83e
Closes-bug: #1471751
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/74/198674/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: VMware: ensure that get_info raises the correct exception
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-14 09:28:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3fec152ba84e0c60e8f51c10dcfa9e3448a71c24', 'message': "VMware: ensure that get_info raises the correct exception

In the event that a instance is deleted during the get_info method
then the method would not raise the correct exception.

If the instance no longer exists then the VC will raise
a 'ManagedObjectNotFound' exception.

Note that the oslo.vmware patch that supports this exception is:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/191553/

This exception handling is treated by using vexc.register_fault_class

commit_message:
VMware: ensure that get_info raises the correct exception

In the event that a instance is deleted during the get_info method
then the method would not raise the correct exception.

If the instance no longer exists then the VC will raise
a 'ManagedObjectNotFound' exception.

Note that the oslo.vmware patch that supports this exception is:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/191553/

This exception handling is treated by using vexc.register_fault_class
to support the local exception (until replaced by oslo.vmware)

Co-Authored-By: Radoslav Gerganov <rgerganov@vmware.com>

Change-Id: I2d4b131789319cfd1322cbc95edd7822114532e1
Closes-bug: #1464979

commit_message:
Add ubuntu-trusty node to os-ansible-deployment

This patch adds an ubuntu-trusty node-based non-voting
check to os-ansible-deployment to help determine whether
the differing images between hpcloud and raxcloud are
contributing to the gate check failures seen solely in
hpcloud.

The idea is to use the exact same image across both
clouds to see the results.

Change-Id: I7809e3f4b3012586f4aaa0de9d9bc7b0011e720d

commit_message:
Commonize config usage for base test classes

Derive DbTestCase from BaseTestClass to use config fixture as a
preffered way for such things. Initialize full set of config options for
all tests.

This leaded to some reworking of db initialization in DBTestCase.

Change-Id: Ibec8406f141a74c6f42f6c9d502ced0008ae0214

commit_message:
Return volume name from backup_restore

Currently volume id and backup id are returned, the change is
to return volume_name also, which is consistent in style with
cinder backup-create.

The related change in python-cinderclient is
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/199846/

APIImpact
It will return additional info "volume_name": volume name when
restoring backup.

Change-Id: I9f5d8ded993fcf1d351d4c65b6806929693b15d6
Closes-Bug: #1472493

commit_message:
Fix attribute error with old glance backend

Glance (<= Havana) does not provide the virtual_size attribute for
images. So we first check if it is available to achieve compatibility
with older Glance versions.

Closes-Bug: #1482657
Change-Id: Iabacb5380e6ad5fa0a2e6749c09072f303cb222d
(cherry picked from commit a8c0c4b2bddb5f65f67f311e0193617c87b93f1d)

commit_message:
pep8: Don't format using self.__dict__

Fix the warning "H501  Do not use self.__dict__ for string formatting"
in swob.py.

In practice, it looks like only self.drive is used in self.__dict__:
RESPONSE_REASONS 507: ('Insufficient Storage', 'There was not enough
space to save the resource. Drive: %(drive)s').

test.unit.common.test_swob checks the HTTP exceptions are correctly
formatted. The test test_507() ensures that the error message contains
the drive name "sda1", the test uses the exception:
HTTPInsufficientStorage(drive='sda1').

Change-Id: I8a91a73b07dfadf5f6b723bc6e6c5785ff60d3c6

commit_message:
Add nonvoting beaker tests to infra/puppet-accessbot

This is the first step towards adding them to all pupept modules.
The tests were already enabled but nonvoting on zuul so this moves the
zuul to the new syntax.

Change-Id: Iff1f0b4d86dfb026cec5ffef9a3e07576017e0bc

commit_message:
Allow resize root_gb to 0 for volume-backed instances

Currently, after an instance launched with bootable
volume and flavor with non-zero disk. If we resize
this instance to an flavor with zero disk, Nova API
will throw exception.

As for volume-backed instance, the root volume doesn't
occupy any space in nova-compute node. So it should not
be limited by flavor's root_gb.

Change-Id: I1ab1a2625650a828b94c0af2147b0aa53a652a82
Closes-Bug: 1480040

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-13 16:17:16.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/disk/mount/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/639d221ed2e5794ac96855e0d929baa4ec0e859e', 'message': 'Retry check for path existence after delay if needed

Trying to perform file injection without libguestfs, i.e. fallback
to nbd device. Although the commands to create device  succeed
the check for file path generates an error.
Inserting a short sleep before rechecking addresses this issue

Change-Id: I127ac1bf8b640ede38e947c6ff64ce2ee6cc2d8d
Closes-Bug: 1484586

commit_message:
Retry check for path existence after delay if needed

Trying to perform file injection without libguestfs, i.e. fallback
to nbd device. Although the commands to create device  succeed
the check for file path generates an error.
Inserting a short sleep before rechecking addresses this issue

Change-Id: I127ac1bf8b640ede38e947c6ff64ce2ee6cc2d8d
Closes-Bug: 1484586
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/19/212619/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def recheck_path(err): rechecks = 3 while not os.path.exists(map_path): time.sleep(1) rechecks -= 1 if rechecks <= 0: break if not os.path.exists(map_path): if not err: err = _('partition %s not found') % self.partition self.error = _('Failed to map partitions: %s') % err else: self.mapped_device = map_path self.mapped = True recheck_path(err)
deleted_lines: if not os.path.exists(map_path): if not err: err = _('partition %s not found') % self.partition self.error = _('Failed to map partitions: %s') % err else: self.mapped_device = map_path self.mapped = True

subject: Limit parallel live migrations in progress
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-12 15:06:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/da8ed47181db4adc2f00193040dfdc8492bd983a', 'message': 'Limit parallel live migrations in progress

This patch extends the previous one to allow limiting the total number of parallel
builds that nova-compute will attempt to cover live migrations. Since we can now
block immediately on the semaphore, this also implements the behavior we have in
build, which spawns a new thread for the process so that we don't starve out
RPC workers waiting on the semaphore. In reality, live migrations take a long time,
so this was something we should have already had.

Further, as soon as we receive the request to do the live migration, we mark the
migration object as status='queued' to indicate that it's waiting for its turn
on the compute node. Once we're given a slot to run, the normal status='preparing'
will be set. This will allow an operator to monitor the status of queued and
running migrations.

DocImpact: Adds a new configuration variable to limit parallel live migrations.
           Zero means "unlimited" and nonzero means "this many in parallel".

Closes-Bug: #1478108
Change-Id: Ia8a796372746b7fc75485dc2e663f270dbd5893a
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-12 15:45:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/dd77225d0927fd6eff8d551cef8e8fd1a494c32a', 'message': 'Limit parallel live migrations in progress

This patch extends the previous one to allow limiting the total number of parallel
builds that nova-compute will attempt to cover live migrations. Since we can now
block immediately on the semaphore, this also implements the behavior we have in
build, which spawns a new thread for the process so that we don't starve out
RPC workers waiting on the semaphore. In reality, live migrations take a long time,
so this was something we should have already had.

Further, as soon as we receive the request to do the live migration, we mark the
migration object as status='queued' to indicate that it's waiting for its turn
on the compute node. Once we're given a slot to run, the normal status='preparing'
will be set. This will allow an operator to monitor the status of queued and
running migrations.

This includes a change to the libvirt driver to avoid spawning another thread
for the live migrations process. That makes it synchronous from the perspective
of compute manager, and in line with all the other drivers that support the
operation. Since compute manager now spawns the thread, libvirt is unaffected
and the other drivers avoid potentially starving the RPC worker pool as well.

DocImpact: Adds a new configuration variable to limit parallel live migrations.
           Zero means "unlimited" and nonzero means "this many in parallel".

Closes-Bug: #1478108
Change-Id: Ia8a796372746b7fc75485dc2e663f270dbd5893a

operation. Since compute manager now spawns the thread, libvirt is unaffected
and the other drivers avoid potentially starving the RPC worker pool as well.

[1] Commit 5a542e770648469b0fbb638f6ba53f95424252ec

commit_message:
Limit parallel live migrations in progress

This patch extends the previous one[1] to allow limiting the total number of parallel
builds that nova-compute will attempt to cover live migrations. Since we can now
block immediately on the semaphore, this also implements the behavior we have in
build, which spawns a new thread for the process so that we don't starve our
RPC workers waiting on the semaphore. In reality, live migrations take a long time,
so this was something we should have already had.

Further, as soon as we receive the request to do the live migration, we mark the
migration object as status='queued' to indicate that it's waiting for its turn
on the compute node. Once we're given a slot to run, the normal status='preparing'
will be set. This will allow an operator to monitor the status of queued and
running migrations.

This includes a change to the libvirt driver to avoid spawning another thread
for the live migrations process. That makes it synchronous from the perspective
of compute manager, and in line with all the other drivers that support the
operation. Since compute manager now spawns the thread, libvirt is unaffected
and the other drivers avoid potentially starving the RPC worker pool as well.

[1] Commit 5a542e770648469b0fbb638f6ba53f95424252ec

DocImpact: Adds a new configuration variable to limit parallel live migrations.
           Zero means "unlimited" and nonzero means "this many in parallel".

Closes-Bug: #1478108
Change-Id: Ia8a796372746b7fc75485dc2e663f270dbd5893a

added_lines: cfg.IntOpt('max_concurrent_live_migrations', default=1, help='Maximum number of live migrations to run concurrently'), if CONF.max_concurrent_live_migrations != 0: self._live_migration_semaphore = eventlet.semaphore.Semaphore( CONF.max_concurrent_live_migrations) else: self._live_migration_semaphore = compute_utils.UnlimitedSemaphore() def _do_live_migration(self, context, dest, instance, block_migration, migration, migrate_data): @wrap_exception() @wrap_instance_fault def live_migration(self, context, dest, instance, block_migration, migration, migrate_data): """Executing live migration. :param context: security context :param instance: a nova.objects.instance.Instance object :param dest: destination host :param block_migration: if true, prepare for block migration :param migration: an nova.objects.Migration object :param migrate_data: implementation specific params """ # NOTE(danms): Remove these guards in v5.0 of the RPC API if migration: migration.status = 'queued' migration.save() def dispatch_live_migration(*args, **kwargs): with self._live_migration_semaphore: self._do_live_migration(*args, **kwargs) # NOTE(danms): We spawn here to return the RPC worker thread back to # the pool. Since what follows could take a really long time, we don't # want to tie up RPC workers. utils.spawn_n(dispatch_live_migration, context, dest, instance, block_migration, migration, migrate_data)

commit_message:
VMware: map one nova-compute to one VC cluster

This patch changes the VMware VC driver to manage only one compute node
which is a vCenter cluster. The support for multiple nodes was
deprecated in the Kilo release with commit
dcd33757dbcfee3c9a0e623f04a722c91de7ed0c and now it is time to be
completely removed.

DocImpact
The 'cluster_name' property is a single string and multiple values are
no longer accepted.

Change-Id: Ifc17c5049e3ed29c8dd130339207907b00433960

commit_message:
Add deleted domain purging spec

Change-Id: I4e755a0cb1c16794b616b53943e442f8b21f363f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-specs refs/changes/15/207115/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================= Deleted domains purging ============================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/designate/+spec/deleted-domains-purging Implementation of a mechanism to routinely purge deleted domains from the database. Problem description =================== Once deleted, domains are not removed immediatly from the database, mostly for billing reasons. They are flagged as deleted in the "deleted" database column and the "deleted_at" column is populated with a timestamp. Currently, deleted domains are purged manually by running SQL queries against the database. The purging process impacts the database performance and requires manual intervention. Proposed change =============== This change is to implement an automated purging mechanism for deleted domains. API Changes ----------- No changes. Central Changes --------------- Implement purging as a periodic task in Zone Manager using a "domain_purge" plugin. The task will select a group of domains and send a RPC call to Central. Central will run a query against the database to purge any deleted domain if needed and log the number of purged domains. Configuration paramenters: - Purging run frequency. Default: hourly. Users might want to run it frequently to minimize the cycle duration. - Per-cycle purging limit. Default: 100. - Time threshold. Default: 7 days. Configuration example:: # Deleted domains purging #------------------------ [zone_manager:domain_purge] # How frequently to purge deleted domains, in seconds #run_interval = 3600 # 1h # How many records to be deleted on each run #limit = 100 # How old deleted records should be (deleted_at) to be purged, in seconds #time_threshold = 604800 # 7 days Storage Changes --------------- No changes. Other Changes ------------- No changes. Alternatives ------------ 1) No change: keeping the current manual process in place. 2) Deleting+purging the domains immediately. 3) Purging the domains on a record creation/deletion event. 4) Purging deleted domains with a single SQL query. Further improvements -------------------- Domains for purging are queried with a column comparison "deleted_at > $date" Query performance can be improved by indexing the "deleted_at" column as a B-Tree (supported by InnoDB and MyISAM): https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/index-btree-hash.html Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: https://launchpad.net/~federico-ceratto Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Juno-1 Work Items ---------- * Implement purging * Update documentation * Implement benchmarks Dependencies ============ TODO

subject: Simplify interface for creating snapshot of volume-backed instance
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-07 05:11:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9322876ba63ac88d625f5008fb99385b71e20e93', 'message': 'Simplify interface for creating snapshot of volume-backed instance

commit_message:
Simplify interface for creating snapshot of volume-backed instance

Initialize new image metadata inside the creation method instead of
outside it. This reduce code duplication.

Also this fixes snapshot creation in EC2, since it had bugs in image
metadata initialization.

Closes-Bug: #1439820
Change-Id: If3efa2a274517a9ad51d5dfff0134ae9e8e702a4

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-05 12:19:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/ba0e3480726d4ba160baed67912f7d27c9395e60', 'message': 'nailgun::ngnix: rate limit /bootstrap traffic

commit_message:
nailgun::ngnix: rate limit /bootstrap traffic

Bootstrap nodes download their root filesystem image via HTTP.
HTTP traffic disrupts DHCP (and TFTP) one due to excessive re-transmissions,
As a result PXE firmware might fail to obtain IP address due to a timeout.
Thus about a half of 200 nodes fail to boot. To work around the problem
rate limit HTTP traffic (per a client) so the collisions rate is reasonably
small and UDP based protocols can work properly.

As a downside downloading root filesystem image of a bootstrap node takes
at least 40 seconds now. For small setups this might be too restrictive,
so limit can be adjusted via BOOTSTRAP/limit_rate parameter in astute.yaml.
Setting the value to zero removes the limit.

Closes-Bug: #1481721

Change-Id: Ib648bba065f78faee15d2d03dc35c390a6570a6b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/86/209486/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Unmount the ephemeral drive before running tests

Some tests (like those run by d-g) expect the ephemeral drive to be
unmounted otherwise they will refuse to format it and fail. As part of
marking the node ready unmount the ephemeral drive if necessary.

Change-Id: Id3eebe3b12e4751ded43b9a99587a5d9b8f9e9ba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/54/202754/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Unmount the ephemeral drive as d-g expects it to be unmounted and # ready for formatting if [ -b /dev/xvde ]; then DEV='/dev/xvde' else EPHEMERAL_DEV=$(blkid -L ephemeral0 || true) if [ -n "$EPHEMERAL_DEV" -a -b "$EPHEMERAL_DEV" ]; then DEV=$EPHEMERAL_DEV fi fi if [ -n "$DEV" ]; then if mount | grep ${DEV} > /dev/null; then sudo umount ${DEV} fi fi

commit_message:
Test script to drive image testing

Support to enable building an IPA image for testing
and script to leverage testing image building.

Change-Id: I31263909d2cb275491e57d7ed8c3f08a86462699
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/84/207184/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash set -eux set -o pipefail export PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1 SCRIPT_HOME=$(dirname $0) BIFROST_HOME=$SCRIPT_HOME/.. # Install Ansible $SCRIPT_HOME/env-setup.sh # Source Ansible # NOTE(TheJulia): Ansible stable-1.9 source method tosses an error deep # under the hood which -x will detect, so for this step, we need to suspend # and then re-enable the feature. set +x source /opt/stack/ansible/hacking/env-setup set -x # Change working directory cd $BIFROST_HOME/playbooks # Syntax check of dynamic inventory test path ansible-playbook -vvvv -i inventory/localhost test-bifrost-create-vm.yaml --syntax-check --list-tasks ansible-playbook -vvvv -i inventory/localhost test-bifrost-dynamic.yaml --syntax-check --list-tasks # Create the test VM ansible-playbook -vvvv -i inventory/localhost test-bifrost-create-vm.yaml set +e # Set BIFROST_INVENTORY_SOURCE export BIFROST_INVENTORY_SOURCE=/tmp/baremetal.csv # Execute the installation and VM startup test. # NOTE(TheJulia): The variables defined on the command line are to # drive the use of Cirros as the deployed operating system, and # as such sets the test user to cirros, and writes a debian style # interfaces file out to the configuration drive as cirros does # not support the network_info.json format file placed in the # configuration drive. ansible-playbook -vvvv -i inventory/bifrost_inventory.py test-bifrost-dynamic.yaml -e testing_user=root -e dib_os_element="ubuntu-minimal" -e dib_packages='openssh-server' EXITCODE=$? if [ $EXITCODE != 0 ]; then echo "****************************" echo "Test failed. See logs folder" echo "****************************" fi echo "Making logs directory and collecting logs." mkdir ../logs sudo cp /var/log/libvirt/baremetal_logs/testvm1_console.log ../logs/ sudo chown $USER ../logs/testvm1_console.log dmesg &> ../logs/dmesg.log sudo netstat -apn &> ../logs/netstat.log sudo iptables -L -n -v &> ../logs/iptables.log sudo cp /var/log/upstart/ironic-api.log ../logs/ sudo chown $USER ../logs/ironic-api.log sudo cp /var/log/upstart/ironic-conductor.log ../logs/ sudo chown $USER ../logs/ironic-conductor.log exit $EXITCODE

commit_message:
Validate quota class_name

If you pass class name with more than 255 characters to
quota-class-update api, then it returns 500 error code.

Added a check to validate string limit and returned 400 if
limit exceeds.

Closes-Bug: #1463396
Change-Id: I1bb924679ee41f48933b86b5509700ab716507f7

commit_message:
Fix message missing after duplicated message error

Message will not be handle after acknowledge failure, but it will store
in cache to prohibit handle duplicate message by skipping it.
So a message can be missed if client receive a duplicate message.

Fix this problem by store the message info in cache after a successfuly
message acknowledgment.

Change-Id: I907a58199eeadac22c31490111ec51ee6dd874d5

commit_message:
Move V2.1 API unittest to top level directory

This patch moves the tests in contrib/ and plugins/v3/ into the
base directory.

Note that some of the tests have both v2 and v21 tests, The v2
tests will be deleted when V2 API removed.

Co-Authored-By: Ed Leafe <ed@leafe.com>
Change-Id: I6ff1d6594e7a44f2bcb6bbb04a4277b98d1cac74
Partial-Bug: #1462901

commit_message:
Updated max_len configuration

A recent update to max_len permits setting the "tab handling"
property as a third parameter, telling eslint how to count a tab if
it is encountered. A different rule enforces spaces in our code, so
this is not strictly necessary, however for the sake of
safety this explicitly sets our tab handling to our indent rate: 2

Change-Id: I05a8167bca324ba14b4d29af44358c3ffe2f6c2e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/eslint-config-openstack refs/changes/55/214355/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Added SwitchCase to indent.

This additional rule will validate that case statements inside of
switch blocks are indented by x-times the normal indent. In this
case it is 1x the normal indent -> 2 spaces. The default is 0.

Change-Id: Ib79e859d1ec3aaafdc22c886a9c01030d5f913c7

commit_message:
Replace get_cinder_client_version in cinder.py

Due to bug 1386232 Nova has forked get_volume_api_from_url method from
python-cinderclient. As the bug is fixed now this commit removes Nova's
version and replaces usages with cinderclient's one.

Depends-On: Idce26be00db8551d265fe668975a5843c772dd65
Change-Id: Ib0043786c808b470078d65db0d874720f99e583e
Closes-Bug: 1465627
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/58/192158/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: version = cinder_client.get_volume_api_from_url(url)
deleted_lines: version = get_cinder_client_version(url)def get_cinder_client_version(url): """Parse cinder client version by endpoint url. :param url: URL for cinder. :return: str value(1 or 2). """ # FIXME(jamielennox): Use cinder_client.get_volume_api_from_url when # bug #1386232 is fixed. valid_versions = ['v1', 'v2'] scheme, netloc, path, query, frag = urlparse.urlsplit(url) components = path.split("/") for version in valid_versions: if version in components: return version[1:] msg = "Invalid client version '%s'. must be one of: %s" % ( (version, ', '.join(valid_versions))) raise cinder_exception.UnsupportedVersion(msg)

commit_message:
Add a non-voting py34 check job to Horizon

I'm porting the Horizon project to Python 3, we are very close to have a
working "tox -e py34" (it pass with
I69aeaf172d1d405dfeb4d2314f7bf0c571760201).

Change-Id: I73dac796b7c8523d6df5966b202a5041f86e2eba

commit_message:
Add instance action events for live migration

Instance action events records are missing for live-migration.
This patch fix it.

Change-Id: Ia9c46e19e643f5f70da1c7221a1099f322c4c6ed
Closes-Bug:1468212

commit_message:
VMware: Do not untar OVA on the file system

The OVA image is a tarball which consists of OVF descriptor and VMDKs.
Currently the OVA is unpacked on the file system and then uploaded on
the datastore. This is inefficient and may cause n-cpu to run out of
space if large images are booted.
This patch fixes this by processing the OVA image as a stream -- we
subsequently read chunks of data from Glance and upload them to
vCenter.

Change-Id: I22f5897da0870a1d69fa153a0868000369159b37
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/19/158319/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: read_handle = rw_handles.ImageReadHandle(read_iter) with tarfile.open(mode="r|", fileobj=read_handle) as tar: vmdk_name = None for tar_info in tar: if tar_info and tar_info.name.endswith(".ovf"): extracted = tar.extractfile(tar_info) xmlstr = extracted.read() vmdk_name = get_vmdk_name_from_ovf(xmlstr) elif vmdk_name and tar_info.name.startswith(vmdk_name): # Actual file name is <vmdk_name>.XXXXXXX extracted = tar.extractfile(tar_info) write_handle = rw_handles.VmdkWriteHandle( session, session._host, session._port, res_pool_ref, vm_folder_ref, vm_import_spec, file_size) start_transfer(context, extracted, file_size, write_file_handle=write_handle) extracted.close() LOG.info(_LI("Downloaded OVA image file %(image_ref)s"), {'image_ref': instance.image_ref}, instance=instance) imported_vm_ref = write_handle.get_imported_vm() session._call_method(session.vim, "UnregisterVM", imported_vm_ref) LOG.info(_LI("The imported VM was unregistered"), instance=instance) return raise exception.ImageUnacceptable( reason=_("Extracting vmdk from OVA failed."), image_id=image_ref)
deleted_lines: ova_fd, ova_path = tempfile.mkstemp() try: # NOTE(arnaud): Look to eliminate first writing OVA to file system with os.fdopen(ova_fd, 'w') as fp: for chunk in read_iter: fp.write(chunk) with tarfile.open(ova_path, mode="r") as tar: vmdk_name = None for tar_info in tar: if tar_info and tar_info.name.endswith(".ovf"): extracted = tar.extractfile(tar_info.name) xmlstr = extracted.read() vmdk_name = get_vmdk_name_from_ovf(xmlstr) elif vmdk_name and tar_info.name.startswith(vmdk_name): # Actual file name is <vmdk_name>.XXXXXXX extracted = tar.extractfile(tar_info.name) write_handle = rw_handles.VmdkWriteHandle( session, session._host, session._port, res_pool_ref, vm_folder_ref, vm_import_spec, file_size) start_transfer(context, extracted, file_size, write_file_handle=write_handle) extracted.close() LOG.info(_LI("Downloaded OVA image file %(image_ref)s"), {'image_ref': instance.image_ref}, instance=instance) imported_vm_ref = write_handle.get_imported_vm() session._call_method(session.vim, "UnregisterVM", imported_vm_ref) LOG.info(_LI("The imported VM was unregistered"), instance=instance) return raise exception.ImageUnacceptable( reason=_("Extracting vmdk from OVA failed."), image_id=image_ref) finally: os.unlink(ova_path)

commit_message:
allow non '/' root for dashboard

Currently, there is a hard coded value for the login url for the
dashboard in the tempest config. The root for dashboard needs to
be configurable in tempest as well. This patch allows construction
of the login url from information on the page and the hard-coded
url for the dashboard in the tempest config.

The main goal of this patch is a bridge between current use of '/'
and '/dashboard' for the horizon root in devstack. If desired, post
switch we can update the hardcoded value. And revert this patch.

Related change: I6fbca5cea9e44df160afbccc71bd045437657320

Change-Id: I9a04f936ed6d8c14775a332dc28e903992806c42
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/39/212239/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: login = None def _find_attr_value(self, attrs, attr_name): for attrpair in attrs: if attrpair[0] == attr_name: return attrpair[1] return None if tag == 'form': self.login = self._find_attr_value(attrs, 'action') # construct login url for dashboard, discovery accomodates non-/ web # root for dashboard login_url = CONF.dashboard.dashboard_url + parser.login[1:] req = request.Request(login_url)

commit_message:
Location of the "local.conf" file is confusing. It is updated.

It was shown that the local.conf is at root devstack directory, but
it is at devstack/samples directory. So the path is updated.

1.) Copy the file into root Devstack directory.

Change-Id: I6ff8a404a3664c892bb458023c57ccc5d0926fdf
Closes-Bug: #1464491
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/00/211100/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The new configuration file is ``local.conf`` and resides in the ``devstack/samples`` directory, copy this file into the root devstack directory where the old ``localrc`` file resides. It is a modified INI
deleted_lines: The new configuration file is ``local.conf`` and resides in the root DevStack directory like the old ``localrc`` file. It is a modified INI

We stopped supporting downgrades in OpenStack.

commit_message:
Change cinder_volume_driver config option to enable_ceph

We are going to support two types of config - ceph or lvm. There's
no need for templating further support for cinder drivers. If
there is an interest for other drivers, operators can provide their
own overrides to the cinder config files.

Change-Id: I48d0d8eb5e5c81c3c00474f3932bd7f5b4642f5a
Closes-Bug: #1485704
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/40/213840/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: enable_ceph: "no"

test_list_tenants_returns_authorized_tenants() test uses
non-admin user's token to make a request to list tenants.
Test checks that user can see only that tenants that he
was bound to.

Added a new non-admin client to make Identity API v3 request
for list tenants as a non-admin user. Since 35357 port is
used as administrative endpoint it is not correct to use
this admin port for testing keystone public user actions.
In addition that is useful for testing public clouds where
this test via 35357 port would not pass because in public
clouds 35357 port endpoint is unavailable.

for list tenants as a non-admin user. Since 35357 port is
used as administrative endpoint it is not correct to use
this admin port for testing keystone public user actions.
In addition that is useful for testing public clouds where
this test via 35357 port would not pass because in public
clouds 35357 port endpoint is unavailable.

commit_message:
Added list_projects non-admin test to identity/v3/test_projects

test_list_projects_returns_authorized_projects() test uses
non-admin user's token to make a request to list projects.
Test checks that user can see only that projects that he
was bound to.

Change-Id: Ia5a60c7022739293046b9341d95c3869da834c56

commit_message:
Removed special treatment for feature/qos branch

The feature is merged into master now, so we don't need the branch, and
we also don't need those hacks to enable QoS specific config knobs for
it.

Change-Id: I69f124cd39bbd2c7e3ac8b8f1040503ca9bd82f6
Partially-Implements: blueprint quantum-qos-api

commit_message:
Add V2.1 API tests parity with V2 API tests

There are some basic wsgi stack tests in test_api.py. But it is only
for V2 API. This patch adds V2.1 API tests on it.

Partial-Bug: #1462901
Change-Id: Ib0d9c15ca37a12c661a8abc8b8e59deab91f0d80
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/92/212392/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make X-IO volume driver wait for delete volume to complete

Add a check to make sure the volume has been deleted from
the backend storage before returning from delete_volume.

Change-Id: Icc662de476fcb21ff2f7ca6aa69e46c434214d7e
Closes-Bug: #1482044
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/57/209757/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NOTFOUND_STATUS = 'NOT FOUND' # 1.1.3 Wait for volume/snapshot to be deleted. vol_info['string'] = NOTFOUND_STATUS if resp['status'] != 204: LOG.warning(_LW("Delete volume %s failed!"), volume['name']) return # DELETE call successful, now wait for completion. # We do that by waiting for the REST call to return Volume Not Found. args['method'] = '' args['url'] = '' args['name'] = volume['name'] args['status_string'] = NOTFOUND_STATUS retries = self.configuration.ise_completion_retries vol_info = self._wait_for_completion(self._help_wait_for_status, args, retries) if NOTFOUND_STATUS in vol_info['string']: LOG.warning(_LW("Delete volume %s timed out!"), volume['name'])

commit_message:
Add support '--all-tenants' for cinder backup-list

Also added support '--name', '--status', '--volume-id' arguments
for cinder backup-list.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1422046
Depends On: I73f6377c7d6fd92d0464d13f9c8dd6682fef78e3
Change-Id: I5f2ab6370a8333a9ee498c6158037b0433f36a23

added_lines: def _translate_volume_backup_keys(collection): convert = [('volumeId', 'volume_id')] _translate_keys(collection, convert) @utils.arg('--all-tenants', dest='all_tenants', metavar='<0|1>', nargs='?', type=int, const=1, default=0, help='Shows details for all tenants. Admin only.') @utils.arg('--all_tenants', nargs='?', type=int, const=1, help=argparse.SUPPRESS) @utils.arg('--name', metavar='<name>', default=None, help='Filters results by a name. Default=None.') @utils.arg('--display-name', help=argparse.SUPPRESS) @utils.arg('--status', metavar='<status>', default=None, help='Filters results by a status. Default=None.') @utils.arg('--volume-id', metavar='<volume-id>', default=None, help='Filters results by a volume ID. Default=None.') @utils.arg('--volume_id', help=argparse.SUPPRESS) if args.display_name is not None: args.name = args.display_name all_tenants = int(os.environ.get("ALL_TENANTS", args.all_tenants)) search_opts = { 'all_tenants': all_tenants, 'display_name': args.name, 'status': args.status, 'volume_id': args.volume_id, } backups = cs.backups.list(search_opts=search_opts) _translate_volume_backup_keys(backups)

commit_message:
Don't use ipv6 in ironic pxe jobs

The ironic pxe jobs fail tempest due to floating ip attachment issues.
The fix has been proposed to nova [1]. Until that fix gets in force
ironic pxe jobs to use ipv4 only. This will allow us to switch the other
tempest jobs to ipv4 + ipv6 by default.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/168701/

Change-Id: I126da44dcf5f5cbbbab5f3814a3264aad8c06da6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/72/176072/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove redundant response schema check

All schema of compute action APIs are already implemented.
So we can remove the response schema check as the TODO said.

Change-Id: I473ef1a2916e2c772ee9497fe8d30e199d94669e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/84/212384/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.validate_response(schema, resp, body)
deleted_lines: # Check for Schema as 'None' because if we do not have any server # action schema implemented yet then they can pass 'None' to skip # the validation.Once all server action has their schema # implemented then, this check can be removed if every actions are # supposed to validate their response. # TODO(GMann): Remove the below 'if' check once all server actions # schema are implemented. if schema is not None: self.validate_response(schema, resp, body)

commit_message:
Make attach_volume use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes attach_volume use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ibc7f5c80755876318e1f5c7f7548276f315467c6

commit_message:
Create hooks for running functional test

Create hook so that we can introduce a new job to test the VPN test cases
using the VPN devstack plugin, and run other test cases w/o the plugin
enabled.

I2db939bf99288c0cdec06cdd49fec3bdc72e5253 adds the ability to use a gate
hook and creates experimental jobs for both core and VPN tests, named
gate-neutronclient-test-dsvm-functional and
gate-neutronclient-dsvm-functional-vpn, respectively.

A follow-up commit will move the VPN test cases, and modify tox.ini to
support two jobs, one for VPN tests and one for other tests.

Change-Id: Ieeaca1375d68705509f4e05f10cb35c0fa0b9582

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 The Johns Hopkins University/Applied Physics Laboratory # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ X509 Class This module defines the X509 class, used to represent X.509 certificates. """ from castellan.common.objects import certificate class X509(certificate.Certificate): """This class represents X.509 certificates.""" def __init__(self, data): """Create a new X509 object.""" self.data = data def get_format(self): """This method returns 'X.509'.""" return "X.509" def get_encoded(self): """Returns the key in its encoded format.""" return self.data def __eq__(self, other): if isinstance(other, X509): return (self.data == other.data) else: return False def __ne__(self, other): result = self.__eq__(other) return not result

commit_message:
Remove 'v3' directory for v2.1 json-schemas

This is step 4 of the remove v3 process. It moves the v2.1
json-schemas out of v3 directory, and also corrects all the
references.

Change-Id: Ibf88c38df951ed755b7431846cca7496f861c1dd
Partial-Bug: #1462901

commit_message:
Dedicate aggregates for specific tenants

Extend the "AggregateMultiTenancyIsolation" scheduler filter
in order to optionally exclude instances from being scheduled
for deployment in hosts that don't belong to the defined
aggregate(s). This behavior is defined by "exclusive_tenant_id"
metadata key.

Implements: blueprint multi-tenancy-isolation-only-aggregates
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ief5ab81bd0622ff54964fbc0de1110708d814add
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/83/195783/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_config import cfgimport six from nova import context from nova.objects import aggregate as aggregate_objaggregate_multitenancy_isolation_tenant_exclusive = cfg.BoolOpt( 'aggregate_multitenancy_isolation_tenant_exclusive', default=False, help="If true, instances from tenants which are specified in any aggregate" " cannot be scheduled in hosts outside reserved aggregate(s).") CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opt(aggregate_multitenancy_isolation_tenant_exclusive) class AggregateMultiTenancyIsolationBase(filters.BaseHostFilter): _tenant_id = None def _get_tenant_id(self, filter_properties): """Gets tenant id from filter properties.""" spec = filter_properties.get('request_spec', {}) props = spec.get('instance_properties', {}) tenant_id = props.get('project_id') return tenant_id def get_tenant_id(self, filter_properties): """Gets tenant_id from filter_properties (or from "cache").""" if self._tenant_id is None: self._tenant_id = self._get_tenant_id(filter_properties) return self._tenant_id def check_metadata(self, host_state, metadata, tenant_id): """Checks whether metadata have "filter_tenant_id" key with value containing tenant id.""" if metadata != {} and tenant_id not in metadata["filter_tenant_id"]: LOG.debug("%s fails tenant id on aggregate", host_state) return False return True tenant_id = self.get_tenant_id(filter_properties) passes = self.check_metadata(host_state, metadata, tenant_id) return passes class AggregateMultiTenancyIsolationExclusive( AggregateMultiTenancyIsolationBase): """Isolate tenants in specific aggregates without possibility to spawn instances on the other hosts.""" reserved_aggregates = None def get_reserved_aggregates(self, tenant_id): """Gets the reserved aggregates for given tenant.""" admin_context = context.get_admin_context() aggregates = aggregate_obj.AggregateList.get_by_metadata_key( admin_context, 'filter_tenant_id') reserved_aggregates = filter(lambda aggregate: tenant_id in aggregate.metadata['filter_tenant_id'], aggregates) return reserved_aggregates def initialize(self, filter_properties): """Initializes filter by storing information about aggregates dedicated to tenant.""" tenant_id = self.get_tenant_id(filter_properties) self.reserved_aggregates = self.get_reserved_aggregates(tenant_id) def filter_all(self, filter_obj_list, filter_properties): """Calls the initializator before performing standard filtering.""" self.initialize(filter_properties) return super(AggregateMultiTenancyIsolationExclusive, self).filter_all(filter_obj_list, filter_properties) def check_metadata(self, host_state, metadata, tenant_id): """If a host is in aggregate that doesn't have the metadata key "filter_tenant_id" and there are any other aggregates having this metadata, instance can't be created on this host.""" passes = super(AggregateMultiTenancyIsolationExclusive, self).check_metadata(host_state, metadata, tenant_id) # If aggregate is not reserved for any tenant and tenant have some # other reserved aggregates. if metadata == {} and len(self.reserved_aggregates) > 0: passes = False return passes class AggregateMultiTenancyIsolationMeta(type): def __call__(self, *args, **kwargs): if CONF.aggregate_multitenancy_isolation_tenant_exclusive: klass = AggregateMultiTenancyIsolationExclusive else: klass = AggregateMultiTenancyIsolationBase return klass(*args, **kwargs) @six.add_metaclass(AggregateMultiTenancyIsolationMeta) class AggregateMultiTenancyIsolation(object): pass

commit_message:
Enable log_slave_updates

Without log_slave_updates enabled, the bin logs are only written on the
cluster server that handles the request. This makes database recovery
more difficult as the bin logs are spread across all servers and must be
combined manually in order to recover the database.

Enabling log_slave_updates ensures all nodes in the cluster contain the
complete bin logs and recovery can be performed from any cluster member.

Change-Id: I978d6aea93369382faeace96b7865b9e56a7995a
Closes-Bug: #1479473
(cherry picked from commit 41332ab35f5ff667cd5d3fdbecf03ffac0e87147)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/76/214576/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: log_slave_updates = 1

commit_message:
Rename bad option value

To disable tempest running the v2 tests when the identity v2 api is
disabled you need to set api_v2=False not v2_api=False.

Change-Id: Ied8a0593619dccb5985f9a1e51feb370754336c7

commit_message:
Move horizon apache root to /dashboard

With keystone's move to /identity, a conflict in for resources was
created as both keystone and horizon used /identity. The keystone
config took precedence and rendered API output in the horizon UI.

This patch sets the root for horizon to /dashboard and serves all
horizon content from there. Additionally, a RedirectMatch has been added
to the apache config for horizon to redirect '/' to '/dashboard' this
will allow the implementation to change without being immediately
painful to users.

Also made the path '/dashboard/' configurable in stackrc.

Closes-Bug: #1478306
Depends-On: I9a04f936ed6d8c14775a332dc28e903992806c42

for devstack-gate changes to remove hard coded horizon url structure
assumptions.

Change-Id: I6fbca5cea9e44df160afbccc71bd045437657320

Return v2 version info with v2 legacy compatible wrapper

When v2 legacy compatible wrapper enabled, the version API should
return v2 version info.

Implements blueprint api-relax-validation

commit_message:
Adding clusters_update api call

Adding ability to edit clusters (only description and name
at this moment)in order to change their public/protected
attributes later

APIImpact

PATCH /v1.1/{tenant_id}/clusters/{cluster_id}

Partially implements:: blueprint api-for-objects-update

Change-Id: I7b86362e4db576ba5cdb20dff1ae904497a1852a

commit_message:
Use start status of coodinator in tooz

CoordinationDriver of tooz has maintained the status about coordinator
started or not. we don't need to re-define a _started in ceilometer.

Depends-on: I1a177cf3efd63593667751c6b53bcc536fb0670f

Change-Id: I8487275b419e355548ef9df6e7c8515f569f83bd

commit_message:
Reduce openstack-ansible commit check timeout

We're seeing issues on hpcloud build nodes where some checks run until
the full build timeout, but barely get anything done.

Examples:
http://logs.openstack.org/92/210492/10/check/gate-os-ansible-deployment-dsvm-commit/c582f2f/
http://logs.openstack.org/92/210492/6/check/gate-os-ansible-deployment-dsvm-commit/dc16799/
http://logs.openstack.org/74/194474/20/gate/gate-os-ansible-deployment-dsvm-commit/cda0778/
http://logs.openstack.org/16/210516/2/check/gate-os-ansible-deployment-dsvm-commit/6cf0e08/

This patch reduces the commit check timeout from 120m to 90m. Our
average successful build is at around 70 minutes, so this is a safe
build timeout and allows us to recheck appropriately in a more
timely fashion.

Change-Id: Ia4c0d73b62a6cf1bb5f255a786616ae494f95777

commit_message:
Add base for IPA functional tests

Starts up an agent in a thread and then runs functional tests against
it.

Add the first functional test of the API: a simple test of the
commands API.

Co-Authored-By: Mario Villaplana <mario.villaplana@gmail.com>
Change-Id: If4ad611929d388a2a9454224646cb296bd0ba0ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/49/213249/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Rackspace, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import logging import multiprocessing import time from oslotest import base as test_base import requests from ironic_python_agent import agent class FunctionalBase(test_base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): """Start the agent and wait for it to start""" super(FunctionalBase, self).setUp() mpl = multiprocessing.log_to_stderr() mpl.setLevel(logging.INFO) # Build a basic agent using the config option defaults self.agent = agent.IronicPythonAgent( 'http://127.0.0.1:6835', 'localhost', ('0.0.0.0', 9999), 3, 10, None, 300, 1, 'agent_ipmitool', True) self.process = multiprocessing.Process( target=self.agent.run) self.process.start() # Wait for process to start, otherwise we have a race for tests tries = 0 while tries < 20: try: return requests.get('http://localhost:9999/v1/commands') except requests.ConnectionError: time.sleep(.1) tries += 1 raise IOError('Agent did not start after 2 seconds.') def tearDown(self): super(FunctionalBase, self).tearDown() self.process.terminate()

commit_message:
Fix quota-update when nova-compute startup finish

As of now reserved quota for the instances which were stuck in
deleting task-state while resizing was in progress, are not updated
accordingly on nova-compute start-up. This is because in present
code if quota delta is negative then reserved quota is not updated
while committing the quota.

Added new db interface to get latest migration object based on
instance id, as there might be many migration records for the same
instance id. To calculate correct quota delta, it requires latest
migration record.

Added new flag 'invert_quota' which default to False in quotas
object commit() method. With this change it is possible to invert the
reserved quota, if delta is negative and invert_quota value is True.

Added code to pass correct in_use quota to _delete_instance method
and update the reserved quota if instance was resizing when user has
sent request to delete the instance.

Change-Id: I6859fa057bf8fcfeed20b691eeaee331741ea1fa
Closes-Bug: 1296414

commit_message:
Fix attribute error with old glance backend

Glance (<= Havana) does not provide the virtual_size attribute for
images. So we first check if it is available to achieve compatibility
with older Glance versions.

Change-Id: I5970e8e6c61c4ee562cdc63a77661ad1801bf98d
Closes-Bug: #1482657
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/54/213054/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: image.bytes = getattr(image, 'virtual_size', None) or image.size

commit_message:
Allow case insensitive compare of choice values

This patch will help deployers who might specify a StrOpt value
that uses choices with the incorrect capitialization.

This will also help with backwards compatibility when a going from
a StrOpt that allowed case insensitivity to a StrOpt with choices.

Required for I8d9ee833263560caaffe083487abc5eda862f8ea

Change-Id: I51cebcca15aaf2970b0e00457cd156d84e7915e8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/25/167025/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_choice_case_insensitive_good(self): self.conf.register_cli_opt(cfg.StrOpt('foo', choices=['BAR1', 'BAR2'])) self.conf(['--foo', 'bar1']) self.assertEqual(self.conf.foo, 'BAR1') def test_conf_file_case_insensitive_choice_value(self): self.conf.register_opt(cfg.StrOpt('foo', choices=['BAR1', 'BAR2'])) paths = self.create_tempfiles([('test', '[DEFAULT]\n''foo = bar1\n')]) self.conf(['--config-file', paths[0]]) self.assertTrue(hasattr(self.conf, 'foo')) self.assertEqual(self.conf.foo, 'BAR1')

Change-Id: I5a4c52a7d18fe406b67dabda9f32759a9190597c

commit_message:
Use config fixrute in BaseTestCase

This gives all tests ability to set custom config options in all derived
classes with no extra efforts.
Also this patch sets fatal_exception_format_errors to True for
BaseTestCase, which will control parameters passed in an exception for
all derived classes.

Change-Id: I5a4c52a7d18fe406b67dabda9f32759a9190597c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ec2-api refs/changes/51/214651/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def setUp(self): super(BaseTestCase, self).setUp() self._conf = self.useFixture(config_fixture.Config()) self.configure(fatal_exception_format_errors=True) def configure(self, **kwargs): self._conf.config(**kwargs)
deleted_lines: pass self._conf = self.useFixture(config_fixture.Config()) self.configure(fatal_exception_format_errors=True) def configure(self, **kwargs): self._conf.config(**kwargs)

commit_message:
Fix exception within exception handler for xmlsec1

When there is an error calling xmlsec1 the handler fails with a TypeError
because the Message object created by _LE() does not support appends.
Separate the output logging from the main logging to avoid this.

Change-Id: I63dbee2a51b7abf9d682c36019f1341f4c83973f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/02/214502/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if hasattr(e, 'output'): msg = _LE('output: %(output)s') msg = msg % {'output': e.output} LOG.error(msg)

commit_message:
Remove spaces around data in transport debug print

The debug transport curl print has spaces around --data ' data '
because of the join at the end.  Also, this adds a test for it.

Change-Id: I2e3ac7bc1cba463f7b7de14c50af5afda4c10234

commit_message:
Added code coverage report to ironic-webclient

This adds code coverage, via the karma-coverage plugin (istanbul),
to the ironic webclient. The results will be uploaded via infra's
"coverage-log" macro, which grabs everything in the 'cover/*'
directory.

Change-Id: Ia171805d4c2ed25f4b5ba5a4d8685cd87deee055

commit_message:
Added extension note for package maintainers.

Some package maintainers are unable to use bower-resolved dependencies
for their tests and package scripts. I have added documentation that
explains precisely where they can add their extension points, to
simplify their build steps.

Change-Id: I9decf2773d8b2b66cf2fe96671286b51f54af84c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-webclient refs/changes/51/213451/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE: This is the extension point for package maintainers. If, rather # than using bower, you would like to link in dependencies from a different # source (ex. debian package), this is the method that would need to be # extended to look for those.

commit_message:
Removed gulp update_dependencies and gulp bower.

All dependencies are now automatically watched and processed
during build/runtime, no pre-install copying or processing
is required. This removes the relevant commands, and adds
bower install to npm install so that the upstream dependencies
are chained.

Change-Id: Ib1cc996171a105fb57866fa8ba30f0febe3b96bd

commit_message:
Explicitly include JS libraries

JS libraries included from upstream carry their own license headers,
so we can't minify those. Also, copying them directly into the src
directory isn't optimal. Instead, we copy all javascript included
in our bower dependencies, and reference them directly in
index.html.

Change-Id: I3c1d27ecd36c3f36e442a7d5a96ccf00ae9a3856

commit_message:
Switched to using SCSS

Horizon uses SCSS. While this does not prescribe what we use, it
does make contribution movements a bit easier.

This patch removes the CSS parsing from bower dependencies, instead
relying on explicit includes from new scss files in the ironic app css
directory. This is better, because it permits us to override theme variables
such as padding and color values before the bootstrap style is constructed.

Furthermore, it is probably not a good idea to concatenate all CSS files
into one lib.css, as some of these files are published under/with their
own license headers, and concatenation/minification usually strips those.

Change-Id: Ib369e8372ab120d2f98fd0dc818818bd15f381d9

commit_message:
Separated font management

Instead of being copied/generated into the source tree,
fonts are now placed into the output tree. They've also
been separated with their own generation and watch target.

Change-Id: I21e2b75547c3c4d5dad7efd0c0f3bd8e5dabce32

commit_message:
Differentiate heat-api from heat-api-* services

Assume heat-api is down, the heat-api process check would not raise
an alarm when lets say heat-api-cfn/heat-api-cloudwatch is still
running.

Hence while checking for heat-api we need to check for 'heat-api '
to differentiate it from heat-api-* services.

Change-Id: Ie08f559b6d32925d25a62c3ba19e829b6f33d602
